Body: Only blends the bottom inch of contents.My old KitchenAid could create full turbulence in seconds

Author: Darin
Title: Leaks. Have to return
Body: Sadly this leaked upon second use. I tightened the bottom as tight as it will go but it still leaked. Sadly I have to return it the same day it arrived. On a positive side, it blended ice as fine as a slurpee. I was excited after my first blended drink. But my second drink spilled everywhere. Bummer.

Author: JSOLO
Title: Straight garbage!!
Body:
The media could not be loaded.
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  
  
   The lid is extremely tight and nearly impossible to pull off without spilling my smoothie. Aside from that, the blender seems to be a dollar store home blender that struggles to blend frozen strawberries.

Author: Shelby Zimmerman
Title: Doesn't work
Body: Bought this for margaritas. Even just putting water in it as a test the blade will just stop moving. It doesn't work unless I turn it off and poke at it with a plastic knife. Idk what's wrong with it but I'm returning it.

Author: Kednerpo
Title: Crushed ice like a pro!
Body: This thing smashes ice like a boss & the pour spout is the best. Super easy to clean, too. Noise level is pretty good but blenders are always going to make noise…

Author: Lara Ragunas
Title: Easy to use
Body: Easy to assemble, use and clean. Does a great job with ice.

Author: John Scott Barnard
Title: Leaked after second use.
Body: Tried removing and tightening the parts, still leaked.

Author: Lynn
Title: not all ice gets crushed
Body: Nice large size for a blender. All the ice cubes do not get crushed and the remaining ice cubes, when kept to blend, shoot up to the lid with a lot of pressure (lid would blow off if your hand was not holding the lid on. I think the blade diplay is small and not enough. For milkshakes with no ice cubes, this would be fine.

Author: Roschell Graham
Title: WORST Blender....EVER!
Body: I usually don't write reviews, but I felt like this needed to be heard. First off, my husband and I purchased this blender to make simple smoothies and whatnot. Upon adding ingredients (all liquids by the way), we turnt it on and the blades started spinning. However, we immediately noticed only the bottom portion of the glass jar was getting mixed/blended, which was the area closest to the blades. We tried SEVERAL different times to get this blender to work properly and blend different contents and it DID NOT no matter what we tried! It was more of a frustration and headache than anything else because we were sooo hoping it would do such a simple job, but it WOULD NOT! After numerous attempts, we gave up and returned it within 3 hours of it being on our countertop. We immediately purchased a Ninja BN805A for over $200 without any hesitation. I would NOT recommend this blender to anyone. If we had happened to be out of the return window, we wouldn't have even donated this blender to someone in need...it would have went straight in the trash AND THAT SAYS A LOT!! To be completely honest, it was actually quite scary the way it preformed.

Author: Deandre
Title: Not really worth the money... Dissapointed and wish I would have returned it sooner
Body: Not powerful at all takes a while to blend things.Best to invest in a Vitamix

Author: Kassandra N.
Title: Not what it's cracked up to be
Body: Throws ice and fruit to side, creates an empty funnel space in the middle so it doesn't actually chop and mix anything. Probably fine for just liquids and powder mixes but not for making smoothies or shakes using ice or fruit.

Author: Michael Formoso
Title: Horrible!
Body: I purchased this product and it lasted just under a month neither the seller nor the manufacturer have gotten back to me in reference to returning it? I can’t return it because I made the mistake of throwing away the packaging thinking this product would actually last.

Author: Alec Kaden
Title: Broke 1st week. Avoid.
Body: Broke within the first week. Total crap. Couldn’t handle berries and peanut butter. With blenders, buy nice or buy twice.

Author: JEK
Title: Better than I imagined
Body: Great features, powerful, great for smoothies

Author: Brian Anthony ortega
Title: **Not a good blender**
Body: Not very pleased with this blender. Lid is a light plastic material, It’s very thin but I do have to say it does fit well on Jar. Glass jar is ok, easy to dissemble and clean. The base of the blender is very light. It seems that all speeds are the same. I am currently looking for another blender

Author: Diane
Title: Great Blender
Body: I like the 40oz. size of the blender. It's easy to store and clean. Best of all it, blends everything very well. I would recommend it to anyone.

Author: Rebecca
Title: Couldn’t even make a smoothie.. worst blender I’ve ever used
Body: The whole thing is awful

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Very good blender for smoothies
Body: Bought this as a treat for myself and roommate. I was making smoothies for us using a mini-bullet but having to make 2 small servings wasn't cutting it, ntm it handled ice/frozen food poorly so I needed an upgrade.This blender works wonderfully only issue I have is the noise level (very loud).

Author: Mary W Brown
Title: Just an average blender
Body: Don't like the blending power. It can't handle the volume it suggests

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: lid is hard to get off
Body: has been used for smoothies. The lid is very hard to get off. I would have preferred the kind that is just placed on rather then this type of lid.

Author: KC
Title: DO NOT PURCHASE - the worse blender EVER!
Body: Worse blender I have ever had. It takes so long to blend soft fruits, you have to keep going in with a spoon to mix the fruits, it only blends the bottom layer. It took so long to blend it loosened the bottom and when I went to lift it off the base the glass came up and the bottom stayed in the base. I had the shake all over me and my kitchen. What a mess! Yes, it was tight before I started blending.

Author: Yolanda Sloan
Title: Doesn’t blend at all
Body:
The media could not be loaded.
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  
  
   This product is the worst. I hate to feel like this, but I spent time trying to get it to blend. Does absolutely nothing and I just got it delivered today. I will be returning this item for my money back.

Author: cody
Title: Upset it broke after only 7-8 months
Body: After 8 months of using it the bottom rubber part with the blades rippedAnd started leaking everywhere … so it’s in the trash nowEverything I made my smoothies with frozen fruits I had to take Somthing and mix it up cuz it would get stuck all the time …

Author: Mara B
Title: Don’t believe the hype
Body: The video claims the cord is retractable, but it really isn’t. You have to manually push the cord into the hole on the bottom, but the plug doesn’t fit in the hole, so it doesn’t sit properly. I sent mine back even before I got a chance to use it, so I really can’t review the blending power, etc.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: It does a great job! We use it every day!
Body: We use it every day for smoothies. Beware of holding the lift down if you have a full bowl.

Author: Kathaleena Valdez Jackson
Title: Just the right size
Body: Love the size of this blender when making our meal shakes. Easy to uses and clean.

Author: Sarah Rodriguez
Title: You Get What You Pay For
Body: I used it for a while but I ended up buying a more expensive brand that worked better. 90% of the time, I was blending ice drinks and this blender wasn't blending the ice consistently. The size of the jug was nice, though. For example, if you need to puree something, this does the job.

Author: QB Agent
Title: I made the right choice! Awesome
Body: Completely happy - more than expected. Heavy glass jar and it fits in French Door ice maker. Cleans easy, blender blades are designed incredible. A bit worried that eventually liquids will get down in below buttons but not a problem yet. I would HIGHLY recommend this blender.

Author: Celeste Wilkinson
Title: bought this product twice (2X)
Body: I like this product that I ordered (2) two. Highly recommended.

Author: Moffit
Title: Smells after a bit
Body: Really loud , I can smell burning brushes after a bit.Still occurring even after a few weeks of use

Author: JooliaBoolia
Title: Terrible tool! Beware!
Body: I had a food order that I needed to complete to a deadline so I bought this item from a local store (I live in small town, an hour away from a 'big box store'). Couldn't even grind a mix of 2 c water, garlic & salt! What a piece of garbage. Does not work as described. This not the 'started blender' and I wouldn't gift it to an enemy. Frustration & poor result..

Author: Samuel Monarrez
Title: Disappointing
Body: Sucks at blending ice and frozen fruit. Gets jammed up every time.

Author: 2cats
Title: Not worth the money
Body: This Hamilton Beach Blender was purchased to replace another Hamilton Beach Blender that is 25 years old and still running perfectly was just time for a change. The replacement did not enough power to blend a smoothie the one time it was used had to bring the old one in from the garage that the VA was going to pick up and place it back in service to finish the job. The blades do not extend close enough to the interior of the glass container to create a vortex no mixing can take without it. The weight of the unit was not enough to hold it in place on the counter moved allover. I am sure that the service life would not exceed more than 6 months. Returned the Blender and purchased one that I am sure will provide another 25 years of service. I will be dead before the service life is reached.

Author: cz85b
Title: Why spend a ton of money on a blender?
Body: When this one works exceptionally well?I dinged it on noise level, but it is a blender, and blenders make noise...I liked the fact that it is glass as opposed to plastic. it is easy to clean, and it seems sturdy enough... Overall, it is a great product at any price, I am just glad it is fairly inexpensive.

Author: Jessica Ramos
Title: No me gusto
Body: Tiene muy poco poder, no licua bien, la tapadera es de material delgado y no sierra bien en el vaso de la licuadora, cada que la usó se derrama la salsa por que se abre, lo siento no me gusto 😏

Author: LaBarbara Galloway

Author: Amber

Body: Daughter needed a new one and she picked this one. She loves it

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: To weak to make smoothies
Body: You can smell it burning even when making fruit smoothies.Returning

Author: mauricio

The only thing when I ordered the blender, I wanted the silver Steel and they sent me the black with silver. I kept the blender because it still matched my kictchen. Highly recommend the great quality appliance.

Author: Luz Mendoza
Title: Great blender

Body: After several minutes of blending there are still big chunks of ice, fruit, and herbs, likely because the blades aren't even sharp. It bludgeons more than it blends. Absolutely terrible.

Author: Deni
Title: Piece of junk
Body: Don’t expect this to do anything if you fill it more than a third of the way up. If you fill it any higher, the blades will not move no matter what setting you try to use. I don’t know how this got such high ratings because this thing is terrible.

Author: Linda
Title: Quality product.
Body: Purchased as a gift -- she and children were thrilled to receive it.

Author: schultsie

Body: One day after warranty expired the bottom fell out of the blender and I was unable to return it. There was only one small portion of the bottom that was glued to hold it together. Do not buy this piece of junk.

Author: Lee
Title: Great blender for smoothies
Body: Bought this to replace bullet that made a lot of noise. Works great if you cruch the ice first. Just used the crushed ice setting in fridge.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Love it
Body: We use it to make smoothies love it.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Just don’t buy
Body: Do not buy this blender is cheap and won’t even work to make a smoothie. I have to help mix with a spoon to get it going.

Author: Daniel
Title: It works, it doesn't blend as finely as I would like
Body: Needs more blending power

Author: mdanie2001
Title: Barely a month and it doesn't work already. Waste of money!

Title: Great functionality
Body: The media could not be loaded.

Body: I love the features, the size and the options.

Author: Aurélie Valcin
Title: Hamilton beach
Body: I love this blender

Author: Gaylen Tharp
Title: Stopped Working, Warranty Requires Customer Pay Shipping Both Ways
Body: It worked pretty well for a year and a half and then suddenly stopped working. While it has a 3-year warranty, the customer is required to pay to ship the broken unit back and then also pay for a replacement or repaired unit to be returned. Since this is close to the price of a new blender, it's a clever way to not honor warranties. I had my last blender, an Oster, for more than 20 years. I will never buy another Hamilton Beach blender again and probably will avoid their other products since I assume the warranty practice requiring customers to pay to ship both ways is probably the same.

Author: Tychelle Thompson
Title: Awesome machine
Body: Love my blender

Author: Billinda Mitchell
Title: Great lil Blender
Body: I like it. This blender whips my smoothies right up in no time. Frozen strawberries, no problem. Ice, no problem. It's a little loud, but come on people, it's a freaking blender. Ha I like how the lid pops open and you can pour without taking it off. Only complaint, and I may just be a wuss.... it's a little hard to get the lid off. It attaches like a 'tupperware'. Maybe it will loosen up a little with use. I would purchase again and I would recommend to a friend.

Title: lid does not fit
Body: lid does not fit

Title: Awesome , Nice

Author: Tiffany nichole
Title: Blender did not work well!!!
Body: I was so excited to receive this. I tried to blend ice and the blade will be strong for a couple seconds and then slow down and the ice wasn’t moving. Nothing was blending. Even adding liquid it wasn’t moving much and I had to keep moving the mixture around to get a couple more seconds of blending. Annoying and disappointed ☹️

Author: Lucy
Title: Very disappointed
Body: It doesn’t blend anything at all. Since the blades are so short, all the food got stuck on the top. Only the bottom part got blended. I have tried adding water and everything, nothing works. Not recommended.

Author: Cliente de Amazon
Title: Bad choice for blend, not enough power
Body: No, enough power to blend or mix, and make a high noise

Author: Jennifer
Title: Frustrating Blender
Body: Unfortunately, this blender is a royal pain in every way. The first flaw is that the lid is very flexible and cheap plastic. For some reason, it fits too tightly on the top of the blender and it is basically impossible to get off. I broke a finger nail trying to get it off. I found if I run the glass portion with the top under hot water then it comes off easier. But, then the glass container is slippery and water can get in to what you are mixing. It also makes it dangerous removing the lid because you don't want to put too much pressure on the glass. I have never had an issue like this with any other blender. The other problem I had was at one point the glass was so tightly attached to the base that I had to rotate the blender to remove it which unscrewed the base and the blade causing the contents to leak out. Very disappointing. Finally, the cord is really short which makes it hard to use. This blender is not made well and is not worth the money. I will have to continue using my old Oster blender.

Author: kaz
Title: I would not take a free one if offered! __________ Worst Blender EVER___________________
Body: This blender has been in my home for about 6 months.....way too long. It is messy, poor design, very noisy and creates chunky fruit and veggie smoothies every time. It still runs but I just ordered a new O brand blender just to make my life a little better.-very loud - Messy (leaks from multiple areas)- does not blend finely-Hard to take lid off and on-

That was the only reason I bought for. I suggest look somewhere else for a better choice that will help your family.

Author: Suncat2000
Title: Good value, does what's expected
Body: After our old Hamilton Beach blender broke (after 20+ years of service), we looked for a replacement. Luckily we found what was essentially a modern version. Works fine and the design blends well. The lid snaps over the lid of the heat-tolerant glass carafe, instead of fitting inside like the old one, but the new lid is a little stiff and hard to remove. The function of the blender is not affected and it has enough power to do what it is supposed to do, from frozen drinks to hot soups. All without paying an arm and a leg. Quite satisfied.

It’s not heavy and doesn’t overheat. I don’t have a dishwasher, but it only takes a couple of minutes to clean by hand. Overall, very satisfactory purchase.

I tried using 1 cup instead of 2. Same results. Then, to clean, you have to take it completely apart because the fruit is stuck between the blades and the glass and won't come out. Poorly designed and not worth the money. I just ordered a Ninja.

Title: Disappointing
Body: We got this for basic smoothie blending. I like that it’s a glass jar. Otherwise, I’m not a fan. There’s a little rubber flap in addition to the pouring spout that can be opened on the lid. I guess it’s to allow for more ways to add things in between blending, but it’s very cheaply made. The flap doesn’t stay closed, it pops open on its own randomly. The description says it continuously pulls mixture down into blades, but it doesn’t consistently. Once the lid is on, it's hard to take off to stir or scrape the sides, which I have to do a lot. The blending power is okay. It takes longer than usual to make a simple smoothie.

I've had moderate success pouring things through the spout, but it would have been nice to have at least a small plug in the lid that would let you easily add ingredients while blending.

Makes a great smoothie, does a fancy frozen drink, whips up a great milk shake and can’t complain about the popover batter either. Made a great almond and oat milk also, so give it a chance, it does stand up to the big boys.

Author: Karl
Title: Bad jar design. Does not blend well
Body: The jar does not funnel your food into the blades. No matter what order I put the ingredients in, or what speed I use, the blender instantly cavitates. The blades spin freely in the now liquefied food immediately next to them, but the food above does not move down to get blended.Due to the design of the lid, there's no way to poke it with the back of a spoon or whatever, without completely removing the lid. I wind up having to shake the whole thing violently to get the ingredients to move.

Author: Kevin Johnson
Title: Worthless
Body: Used it once and threw it away.

Author: DM

Body: The price and easy to clean, Bought it to make smoothies, I use it every and sometimes twice a day.

Body: I found this blender very poor at circulating food. What was in contact with the blades blended well, but I have to to continually need to stir the food to get it to come reach the blades even after several tries. I should have purchased a higher quality unit. Also, all of the plastic on the lid and other components is very flimsy and I expect it will not last very long. A waste of money!

Body: I got this blender to replace by 46 year old Hoover solid state blender. After only 3 uses it started to leak. The lid is impossible to get on or off because it is so tight. Very noisy and it took forever to chop or puree completely. Would not recommend.

The jar doesn’t fit very well to the base. The lid is extremely hard for me to put on and even to take off. For me I would not recommend this product.

No more having to struggle to get the seal ring to sit right, especially after multiple washings has deformed the seal ring.I look forward to seeing how well it mixes margaritas in the summer.

I have arthritis so it’s extremely hard for me and it was difficult for my 19 year old as well. It’s noisy but I’ve not owned one that wasn’t. The silver label on the blender is popping out like it’s going to fall off.It is a nice looking blender and it does what I need it for (smoothies.

Author: Cameron
Title: DO NOT BUY
Body: This blender SUCKS....I mean absolutely does not work at all. I tried to make a smoothie several times and it took nearly 10 minutes of me taking off the top every 30 seconds to stir but still would not blend until smooth. Do not buy this if you intend to make smoothies with it. BUT Get this.....it only worked perfectly if i TILTED the blender on its side while blending.... what??? SO disappointing. Unfortunately, I bought this without reading reviews..joke's on me but I will be returning...The amazon review system is so flawed /skewed because this blender has majority of negative reviews but somehow 4.5 stars overall.....absolute trash

Author: PA Medtec
Title: Arrived Broken!!
Body: There was a broken off piece that fell out of package. I could not find anything on the outside broke. However, when I picked the base up out of the box, there was a rattling noise from inside the base. I gently shook it and you could hear loose pieces inside the base. This is obviously broken and I will be returning it. Very disappointed.

Body: Makes great smoothies, I’m not grinding anything but frozen fruit, some fresh fruit and yogurt. Lid with pour spout is great, no need to spend more for fancy bs

Body: I used to love Hamilton beach products. This blender barely crushes ice. I had to buy another blender for more money to do everything I need it do. So again you get what you pay for it.

I noticed some reviews (that almost stopped me from purchasing) complaining that it doesn’t blend well but I also notice they are using only dry ingredients and no water. I like this so much I went ahead and bought one for my friend as a housewarming gift

Author: jared

Author: Kitty

Body: First time using, I added about a cup of mixed frozen fruit (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries) about 1 1/2 cup almond milk and a small scoop of sugar free ice cream. The blender failed to grind, crush, grate, mix without a LOT of fiddling. This blender clearly can’t handle anything frozen.

Author: HaleyASL

Body: I had my doubts, but I have used this blender over a dozen times and it does NOT disappoint! I’ve made smoothies with frozen fruit and milkshakes, mainly. It’s a tad loud, but noise wasn’t a concern for me. I love that the buttons are labeled for ease of use. No cheap plastic, the pitcher is made of heavy weight glass. It has an easy pour spout. It’s easy to clean, too. I would definitely recommend!

Author: Marcos Costas

Author: kim

Title: nA

Author: Spencermom7
Title: I have repurchased this item
Body: We are hard on blenders. Most appliances are created to break after a certain amount of use. I think that is why expensive brands have warranties. This one takes heavy use. We often blend smoothies and icy drinks. Sometimes I use a blender to grind up nuts,oats, or rice. I compared the motors and power of this blender with several others. I have been pleased in the performance, durability and cost of previous Hamilton beach products. I repurchased because kids broke the glass pitcher. The cost of a new pitcher with shipping was about the same cost as repurchasing the whole blender. (I allowed the teens to pay for it)

Author: OSU Marine mom

Body: This is a good blender with a lot of blending options. The only reason I didn't give it four stars is that the lid is very difficult to get on and off and there is only a pour spout on the lid, so you can't add items while blending.

Author: Chip C
Title: Good value, works fine. Plastic lid could be better
Body: I've had this blender about six weeks and use it mostly for smoothies or cocktails. It has worked flawlessly and does exactly what I want. In particular, it provides excellent mixing throughout the glass jar, with no dead spots that I've seen. The glass jar is easy to clean. I took off one star because of two concerns. 1) the plastic lid takes some effort to put on properly, and takes more effort to pull off. Some users might not be able to put it on all the way or, having done so, may struggle taking it off. And I wonder how long the plastic will last. 2) depending on how the blades are rotated, the jar may not fully engage with the base. This could be a problem for new users who don't recognize the condition, or people in a hurry who don't notice that the jar has not settled fully into the base. It is easy to solve but one has to notice it.Every blender I looked at has some negative reviews, even very expensive ones. This is a good basic blender and I'm pretty happy with it. If I could have the same blender with a better lid I'd be happier still.

Author: megan elliott

Title: Requires food to be pushed down with a spoon

I have to push the food down for minutes or the blade just creates an empty space to spin in. And end up grinding the spoon down. Mostly I use it for fruit smoothies, so nothing wildly unusual. I assumed the 700 Watts would do the job, but, no. Probably it's the blade design more than the power I'd guess. I certainly won't be buying this again.

It struggles to blend even the easiest ingredients. It is very clunky and it is hard to clean. Food gets trapped in the bottom and it is very hard to get out. It stopped working almost immediately and by working I mean barely even blending to begin with. Do not recommend! Don't listen to the high rating trust me!!

So if you don't care about making a mess every few times you blend, this cheap blender is the one for you!

When I pulled out the glass pitcher it was filthy (covid 19!!!) It was covered in fingerprints and cloudy smudges. After soaking it I put the cheap plastic lid on it. I can not remove it!! I tried for 10 minutes and my roommate also tried. That has to be the reason it was returned and then sent out to me !! Why does Amazon send out used defective products ??

Even if I added more liquid i still had to stop and stir to get it to blend thoroughly. purchased a month ago and definitely don’t recommend this product .

Author: Look4ABook
Title: Trash
Body: I got this Blender last week. Instructions were minimal. Buttons that indicate what to select for what you’re blending don’t make sense. Fits easily into the base, which was sometimes a problem with my last blender. Has a glass container, which I wanted.So my very first use was to make a protein drink from a mix, with ice, soy milk and a banana. Mixed pretty well.Then I tried to take the lid off to pour it out and clean it. I pulled, tried to pry it up, used a dish towel for a better grip, looked for lid removal instructions that weren’t there. The flimsy rubber/plastic lip of the lid ripped but it’s still stuck tightly on the jar.The pamphlet that came with it gave a phone number to call for “friendly” people to answer questions. No friendly people. The number only refers you back to the pamphlet and website. The website has a form to fill out in hopes you’ll hear back.Glad I wasn’t mixing something for dinner guests.I just want the lid off so I can return this thing.

Body: This is a terrible blender. The seal on the lid is so tight that it’s very very difficult to remove after blending. I don’t use a blender very often but I cannot recommend this one and will probably buy a different one. It took 3 adults numerous times trying to remove the lid before we were successful.

Author: Cas
Title: I’m really enjoying this blender!
Body: Blending power is great! I crush ice in it every single day! Super easy to clean!

Author: JD
Title: They do not make them like they used to, but then nobody does
Body: This blender was going to have a tough time measuring up, since it was replacing one that cost twice as much and had lasted for nearly 20 years - and even then it was the jar that cracked. On the positive side, the wide base of the jar and the multiple settings mean that it blends anything without clogging and to different consistencies. The shape of the jar also makes it very easy to clean, which I do by hand rather than running it through a dishwasher. On the negative side, one of the reasons it blends so well and does not clog is that it throws contents all over the jar and lid, no matter what is being blended and no matter what setting. Having to use a rubber spatula to recover contents, and the extra cleaning involved, are not major problems, but for me they are the difference between a four star and a five star review.

Author: Sabistrie
Title: Awesome
Body: It's durable

Author: Jonathan S Micklethwait

Author: Ramesh
Title: Worst product and horrible support
Body: Blender was well taken care and was sparingly used. However, glass jar broke near the bottom where it gets attached to the motor. When we contacted the customer support, we were told that glass jar is not covered in warranty. How can a well known brand like Hamilton Beach can sell an inferior quality product and cover themselves with such petty excuse. I don't have a control on the quality of the glass jar and if it was tested for strength and tenacity. Stay away and save your money elsewhere!!

Just put a little soap and water and hit the cleaning button and you never have to worry if you are getting the bottom and the blades clean. Cover is a very tight fit, which I like, but if you have any problems with your hands , it may be an issue for you. Great purchase.

So it was a major disappointment when the liquid started leaking out of the bottom after only a few uses. Turns out the plastic base had cracked. Not equipped to handle frozen fruits for smoothies. We are now searching again for another blender as we tossed that one. We had discarded the box, or we would have returned it.

Body: Bought this on sale its standard loud blender which is loud. Blends the same as my old $20 one.Except the wide base seems to bring everything down better than the smaller cone based blenders do in my opinion.

Author: Elizabeth
Title: Love it.
Body: Very easy to use and clean love making my smoothies and homemade salsa with it.

Author: Roy M.

Body: We have ordered this blender twice, first on had the bottom seal go out and it started leaking, this one cracked and chipped. We think it should be replace and we shouldnt have to order anothe none. Please contact us.

Author: Barbara Lucks
Title: Not good for making my smoothies
Body: I DO NOT like this blender! I use a blender exclusively for making smoothies. This machine does not completely blend the ingredients which include finely chopped parsley, very small pieces of celery, cooked prunes, and blueberries. I put water in first and loosely add the other ingredients. After blending for at least a minute on the smoothie setting there are still chunks of the prune, berries, and celery.I sorely miss my cheap (under $25 Oster or my Hamilton Beach $18) Walmart blenders that effortlessly made perfect smoothies. I broke the glass jars to those blenders and decided to order from Amazon for convenience. Now I'm sad.

Author: BETTY BROOKS

Body: enjoying making healthy drinks

Body: Blending power is great! My daughters love using it to make shakes and the consistency is nice. The noise level is to be expected since it's a blender. The blade comes apart for easy cleaning.

Author: Dookaughs
Title: Great for the price
Body: Blends well as expected, longer your blend, the better the result. Lasts for two years with daily use, just bought second on; so i own two jars. Although the blade seems to need replacement every year about, idk 10 bucks on amazon. They get louder over time with wear and tear, until the internal bearings brake free. They so wear in with pulse modes but it does increase wear. Its a well built machine like a mazda but its not an exotic

Body: Haven't done much yet to comment

Body: It worked 4-5 times then the bottom piece came off and broke.

Author: Julie
Title: Horrible Product! Cheap!
Body: I had blender two months and it started leaking. Worthless piece of junk. You get what you pay for.

Author: MercyPeace
Title: Not original.
Body: This blender is not an original product from Hamilton Beach. From the first day i got it, The lid is different from the picture. It makes a loud noise. It came without a manual and the. I recently bought a real Hamilton Beach blender and saw a big difference. Less noice , the lid is as shown on the picture, less noise. The cup is not plain it has some designs on it,

Author: yvette
Title: Blender
Body: Don’t know got for my daughter and she said it works great

Author: Oscar
Title: Blender not working after 40 days
Body: The blender is not crushing ice after 40 days.

Author: doogie
Title: struggles to crush just ice
Body: struggles to crush just ice which is the whole reason i got it, considering its called the wave crusher one would assume it would be capable of crushing ice. but still it works very well for smoothie/shake like mixes that have liquid and weight to push the ice into the blades. it is a little bit small though it only makes about 34 liquid ounces worth of smoothie max. which is perfect for me as single bachelor but i could see a two person home or a family having an issue with its lack of size. overall though im happy with it does everything besides crush just ice by itself very well.

Author: Martha Lisa Briley
Title: This is worth the price you pay for it and it is on the cheaper side.
Body: This blender has amazing blending power. I make smoothies using ice cubes and the blender makes my smoothie without any chunks of ice in it. I clean my blender by using soapy water and I run the blender for a few seconds, rinse out and it's looks like new again. It is a bit loud but I don't mind because it works so well.

Author: Fellow Traveler
Title: AMENDING EARLIER RECOMMENDATION
Body: After extensive research, wife picked this blender out of many. She has always used one for years and is very happy with her selection and feels it offers good value and performance for the money.UPDATED REVIEW: After using only 4.5 weeks, blender stopped working. Upon closer examination, it was found that half of the teeth in the gear drive located in the blender base was made of PLASTIC and NOT METAL resulting in a complete meltdown and disintergration (sp.) of 1/2 of the plastic teeth of the gear drive rendering the blender totally inoperable.As the return period for a return of the item to Amazon had just expired, we had no choice, but to discard the virtually new blender and seek out another, more durable high quality brand. Based on this unfortunate experience, this product is NOT RECOMMENDED.

Author: Michael Morris
Title: Excellent power shake blender
Body: The performance far exceeds the price point

Author: jerry isreal
Title: Crushes ice very well
Body: Works very good.

Author: B.J.
Title: Not Worth Your Money!!
Body: If My Friend Had Not Paid For This Item For My Birthday, I Would Send It Back!! I Wouldn't Pay 5 Cents For This Blender!!! It Only Works With Thawed Out Fruits &'Veggies ( For Making Smoothies) It Does NOT Crush Ice Like It Says. It Also Does Not Puree Everything Smoothly!! So Disappointed In This Blender!! I Never Received The Warranty In My Email Either 😡

Author: Dani bo bani
Title: Doesn’t blend
Body: Didn’t blend anything. I made the same smoothie I always make (I have a small Oster) and this didn’t do anything

Author: book lady
Title: Gets the job done!
Body: I bought this for my sister-in-law who had a surgery that required all her food to be pureed for weeks. This blender did a great job.

Author: Teresa
Title: Not
Body: The sticker that shows the letters was already halfOff

Author: rogelio stavill
Title: Lid does not work
Body: Lid is hard to remove and add ice hole is too small

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: That I can count on Blender to work evry time and at the speed that I want..
Body: Liked all functions of this Blender especially the slower speeds I can manage and yet not too noisy.

Author: Jessie Miller
Title: Blender
Body: I love my new blender! It’s one of the best that I have ever had!

Author: constanza mallol
Title: It doesn’t blend finely, it leaves chunks even after minutes blending
Body: It doesn’t really blend easily for smoothies, not finely

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Worst design ever!
Body: It’s hard to clean, really only has 6 speeds, noisy, spits smoothie out the unsealable vent, up-facing blades make product wants to go out the top & finally, food gets caught in the narrow space around the blade unit at the bottom of the glass container. The only good feature is that the gasket is attached, not separate.I feel like someone thought they should make it differently but didn’t bother to try it out!

Author: Heather H
Title: Doesn’t work
Body: This is the worst blender I’ve ever had, the blender that was from the 90s I replaced worked better than this. The blender won’t purée or chop anything, the blades just spin around the middle and doesn’t pull in anything from the sides. I wish I didn’t buy this because now I have to buy another blender that will actually work.

Author: Ruth O'Toole
Title: Flawed design - does not blend anything
Body: The blades and carafe are poorly designed. This blender simply does not blend anything. I wrote to Hamilton-Beach asking for a refund and they did not answer. My daughter continued to use it for her daily smoothies until I got a replacement. She needed to stop the motor every two seconds and reposition the food manually with a spoon. Blend stop stir, blend stop stir--it takes forever to produce a smoothie which isn't even smooth. Also, the built-in rubber gasket disintegrated quickly and it is not a separate piece so not replaceable. The bottom rim of the carafe chipped in the first week. I recommend choosing a different brand. I don't know who they have on their engineering team, but those people need to go back to school!

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Me encanta
Body: Muy buena llego súper rápido y muy fasil de limpiar

Author: MaryFriend Carter
Title: Superb Blending; Top needs Improvement
Body: This blender makes smoothies better than any I have owned. The only thing I dislike is the top for two reasons: (a) it doesn't have an opening to add items while blending, and (b) the top is so hard to get off I have broken fingernails getting it off.

Author: Diane R. Parmigiani
Title: Not impressed
Body: Not impressed with this blender. The lid is tough to get off. I constantly have to stop the blender, take off the lid and push the food down with a utensil because the blades can’t seem to catch it, even though the description says it made to constantly push food toward the blades. I thought I would like all the different speed options but it just makes me confused as if I used the wrong setting if something didn’t come out right.

Author: J. Polyanski
Title: Need finesse to make a smooth smoothie!
Body: Cheaper than other smoothie blenders but need to pay attention to the ratios for a smooth smoothie. I don’t use ice, mainly frozen bananas and a little bit of other frozen fruit like pineapple and some greens. I found that you must go easy on the liquid at first, only adding a bit as needed while everything is getting chopped up, and only drizzling in more liquid when it’s too thick and not moving. Otherwise, you get a chunky smoothie.

It does not blend very smooth, there are always bits and pieces to it. It is really just a blender for quick easy things. Pretty much the price says it all, since it is not too expensive.

I've learned that if you put the ice in first, blend it alone, then add other smoothie items, you get the best output. If I add ice last, I typically get big chunks of ice cubes remaining. The unit is super easy to use, a nice size, and easy to clean.

The price is comparable with others of similar quality, but being glass was the selling point that made me choose this product. Obviously it’s a little heavier than plastic, but incredibly easy to clean.

I had to stir the mixture several times (5-6 times) before it was blended to a reasonable consistency. With the amount of liquid you need to add to get this to even remotely work you can only make smoothies. Also, it just doesn't seem to be able to handle large amounts of frozen fruit. Would not recommend for that purpose. One other small thing is that the cap is very difficult/annoying to remove, which makes stirring the ingredients even more of a pain as there is not large opening at the top.

It has such a snug fit that trying to open the lid is extremely difficult For my hands. Trying to open it, is a mishap about to happen! Lol, I am working on it, because I do not want my husband to have to open it every single time I use it, which is every day. I am sure would not be a problem for many, Otherwise it’s perfectly fine. I would have given it five stars if I can open it up easily, rather 4 stars!

But I like the pulse feature and it handles ice crushing pretty well. There are more plastic parts than on my older blender. I bought it for the no frills; it's adequate and utilitarian and didn't cost too much.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Based on my research. A blender not in the hundreds doesnt last
Body: Not a paid or in anyway compensated review. This is the most surprisingly satisfying purchase I ever made on Amazon. Researching this and all blenders under a couple hundred bucks, I chose this one, but expected it to last a few months before the motor, lid, blades, or canister broke. At the price, I was okay with that.It's been over a year. I make 1 to 3 smoothies with frozen fruit a day, and often make rice milk or blend up vegetables, for soup.Way, way exceeded my expectations. This thing is great.

Body: The glass broke at the base, during use, unbeknownst to me. Ive used it no more than 5 or 6 times since buying it in May, 2020. The broken chip of glass wound up in my food. Thankfully, me, and not anyone in my family discovered it. As I bit into my food, I bit down on the glass chip. First I thought it must have been in the food canned beans I was blending. Title: Good blender for the right price
Body: Overall a great blender for the price! I use it for making breakfast smoothies. I use frozen fruit/frozen spinach and had to figure out what functions to use to blend the best: crushed ice to break up the frozen fruit then once it’s all taken care of then use smoothie setting to get the right consistency. So this blender was basically finding the right setting for what I was working with. I think it was overall great! Self clean is funny cause you can’t fill much water in it other wise it’ll overflow so you need to watch that. I’d still buy it again since it does the job and is affordable. Would recommend.

Author: PEG
Title: not good at frozen fruit smmothies
Body: I got this blender to make frozen fruit smoothies due to the reviews. Sadly I sent it back. I put one cup of milk and one cup of greek yogurt in before I even put the frozen strawberries in. the first day was bad because I put all of the frozen fruit in at once. On the second day, I put only half and the 3rd day only one at a time. Each try I had to take the lid off several times and use a spatula to push the fruit down towards the blades. It became a chore. This blender was supposed to have a wave action that constantly moved the contents from top to bottom, Sadly this didn't happen unless it was all liquid. It's probable excellent with just liquid but not for the smoothies I needed it to make

Author: Pumpkin
Title: Crushes ice and mix smoothies as well as a toy blender
Body: I bought this to replace an old glass Oster blender since it was on sale and had so many great reviews and resembled the glass Oster. Then when I read the low reviews, I see others had the same problems. We make a lot of smoothies and this one says it is great for crushing ice. This thing does not work well and the smoothie ingredients did not get sucked down into the blade and blend like a blender is supposed to do..We attempted 4 smoothies in it. I put the ice in first, as shown on the blender box picture, and would have to use a long spoon to move ingredients around to get the thing to even blend. Then I tried putting the bananas/fruit/yogurt in first and the ice (switched to crushed ice even) in last..same problem with it not blending and yogurt was stuck to the glass sides. I don’t know if I got a defective one or what but it is junk. Another issue is the base is made of cheap thin hard plastic as is the lid, unlike my old blender which has a heavy duty flexible plastic lid and a hard plastic base. The lid on this thing was impossible to pry off after making a smoothie that I broke a nail.. also the lid flew across the counter and spewed smoothie mess everywhere. So we went back to using our 20 yr old Oster blender and just bought a new new steel blade for it as it has a metal gear that then goes into the metal blender base.. which tears ice to shreds and blends smoothies. This thing does not have a metal gear assembly but instead has a cheap plastic gear assembly that goes into the hard cheap plastic base.. not made to last.My 13 yr old smoothie queen rolled her eyes and said why did you buy the cheap one.. She wouldn’t use it so we sent it back.

Author: Ag
Title: 4 years later review... smoothies, purees, oats, hummus...
Body: I was randomly scrolling through my old Amazon purchases and realized how long ago I had bought this blender. I've been using it pretty much every single day and I had blended various types of foods in it.Smoothies: Great. it easily cuts any frozen fruit.Ice: Meh. I've always had trouble using it to crush ice. Honestly, I don't think the blade is sharp/big enough to do it, or at least I never could crush a lot of ice. I personally don't really have a need for rushed ice and I get my icy consistency from frozen fruit anyways.Hummus: Great. it works perfectly fine chopping cooked chickpeas (with a little bit of liquid obviously).Oat milk: Great. It chops the oats well.Soup puree: Perfect! I often puree my soups in it and it makes them extra light, fluffy, and thick.Spinach (fresh leaves) puree: Great. I was making spinach roll-ups and needed spinach mixture. Note that I had to add quite a bit of water, but it did chop fresh spinach leaves completely into a smooth puree.Tomato puree aka pizza sauce: Great. It just works.Pesto: Not so good. I know it's not a food processor, but sometimes these blenders can be used for some easy food processor jobs, too. Unlike spinach puree mentioned above, I couldn't add too much liquid into basil leaves. As a result, the blender did not chop the leaves, even though I kept adding more oil, lemon juice, and even greek yogurt. Finally, once it had enough liquid in it, it pureed the basil, but it dd not resemble pesto. For that, you'll need to make your pesto in a food processor or by hand.As far as cleaning goes, it's super easy. Personally I don't like cleaning it, but that's just because you have to take it apart (obviously) and I'm too lazy for that.The power settings on it do not vary that much. For a long time I couldn't really notice a difference between them. Obviously lowest is slow and highest is fast, but I found the labels under each button not useful at all. I mean, it's just a motor, so after a while, I just use whatever setting I feel like is appropriate for the job and often switch between them to make sure everything is blended well.As for the liquid leaking that people mention on here, I personally have never had any leakage UNLESS I didn't properly align the rubber gasket on the bottom of the blender, which is easy to do, but I remember one or two times when I missed.Overall, I think it's a great blender for smoothies and purees and I'd recommend it to anyone.

Author: Carol
Title: Black soot EVERYWHERE!
Body: I notice when I received the box in the mail, the tape closing the box was a little dirty. I didn’t think much of it, because shipping can cause things to get dirty. No big deal right? Well, when I opened the box and pulled out the first piece of equipment - the plastic (very thin I’ll add) lid with pour spout, it was covered in black soot. I remembered reading reviews that said the machine produced a black powder - but thought, “oh, I’ll give it a try, some of these other reviews said it’s great!” So I continued to take the main component(stand/machine) out- COVERED IN BLACK SOOT! and it got everywhere. I promptly put it back in the box, and will be returning it. I don’t know how this machine runs, and can’t speak to its blending capabilities. If it’s already covered in soot, that’s a huge indicator for me of problems down the very short road. I Had to scrub my hands with Dawn to get it out of my fingernails.Be warned: listen to the negative reviews folks, or you too could be covered in soot.

Author: Samantha
Title: Do not recommend buying - It does not last long
Body: I bought this blender in November 2019 and it just died on me today which is now May 2020. The blender worked great for the time being, although it is pretty loud. I used it every day (minus a couple days here and there) to blend smoothies, but then it stopped working today. The drive gear that spins the blades is made out of plastic and has essentially shredded apart and will no longer spin the blades. My recommendation if you use a blender every day is to NOT buy this blender and instead buy one that has a drive gear made out of metal.

Title: Replaced a damaged NutriBullet
Body: When my 6-month-old NutriBullet began to shed black specks and they refused to back their warranty or resolve the situation, I went searching for a replacement. I'm all about my daily morning smoothie, but I didn't want to spend a ton of money. I did a fair amount of research and read the reviews, before I decided on the Hamilton Beach Wave Crusher Blender. So far, so good. It was a great value and has held up to every piece of frozen fruit and countless ice cubes I like to add. I clean the pitcher in the dishwasher every week, too. I have no complaints and can highly recommend this blender.

Title: why buy a vitamix when you can save 300-500?
Body: I bought this some months ago just to use a replacement for my other mixer thinking I would save up for a vita-mix like my friends have, then realized it does everything I need for my frozen smoothie recipes and since i have a food processor for grinding and mixing after a few months saw no need to buy the other item. The power is fantastic grinding frozen cherries , banana etc right from the freezer and so easy to clean- Really how much power do you really need if it can crush ice! If i want hot soup I can still use my blender and heat it up on the stove which is not very often, I use my pressure cooker for those recipes to make larger portions since it make sense to freeze the rest and not have to cook so much.

Author: UrkelJ
Title: I’m satisfied
Body: I finally made a green smoothie... the blender was annoying. There were chunks of the greens while I was drinking, piling up on the rim of the cup. I should’ve taken a picture. There was ample liquid in the mix. I put what was left in the blender back to blend it was a little less mushy, and easier to drink. But still lots of pieces of greens. I’m thinking if I should blend it with hot water to soften up the greens, but then I might as well cook them. With fruits it’s pretty nifty, no complaints. Fresh fruits with ice come out great. If the fruits are frozen definitely will need double the blending time. Triple for greens. In my experience, at least. I’m looking to trying chopping peppers, onions, tomatoes, and the likes next for soups, fresh seasoning, maybe spring for some guacamole.

Title: Sending it back. Blades installed incorrectly.
Body: Two separate blades are supposed to cross each other like a plus sign but instead they are lined up in the same direction like a minus sign. So it's like there are only two blades instead if four. I couldn't figure out why it wouldn't chop vegetables until I read someone else's one-star review describing the same problem.

Author: E. A. Jacques
Title: Nice Blender with Plenty of Power - Easy to Clean
Body: I recently decided to try a vegetarian diet so it was a given I would need a blender to mix up some protein based drinks. I am not sure I will be staying a vegetarian so I did not want to spend $50 or more for a blender since I never needed one before now. Seems like the big factor is whether or not a blender can chop ice. Well this is not a factor for me since I have issues with brain freeze when just taking even a small sip of any slushy type drinks. That made it easier in my mind to go with a less expensive model. Based on the power it seems to have, I suspect it would chop ice just fine, but have not tried it and probably never will.That said, it has real good power and mixes up pretty much anything I put in it with no problem. So far that has been fresh fruit, veggies, soy based milks and various powders - nothing very challenging I suppose. I wanted a blender with a glass jar and this one has a very heavy thick glass jar with a very snug fitting top. I really like the flip open spout on the top too - it's very convenient. I usually mix a blender full of whatever, pour a glass...then put the jar in the fridge to store what is left. The 40 oz size is perfect for my needs and I like that it's shorter and more compact looking.I hand wash my dishes so to clean it I fill it with soapy water, put the top on and shake it to loosen up what is stuck to the sides. I finish the job with a long handled cleaning brush I have and I'm good to go. Doesn't take more than a couple of minutes to get it real clean - which is one reason I wanted a model with a glass jar. I have had plastic blenders in the past and the are just not as easy to clean and eventually get scratched and opaque looking, especially if you put them in a dishwasher. It's not super quiet I guess. I imagine higher end models might be quieter, but that is not a factor for me...hey it's a blender and they make noise. End of story.The only negative I would point out are the buttons on the front are a little cheap feeling so not sure how well they will hold up over time. I suppose that is expected for a blender at this price point. But IMO the heavy glass jar and super tight fitting top are more important features. Plus I could buy two or three of these blenders for the price of one of the higher end models. I only use it once or twice a week so it will probably last me a long time.Overall I am very pleased with this purchase and can recommend this blender for anyone who has similar needs and usage requirements.

Author: Brad Roth
Title: 14 Function" is a Marketing Scam--- Also lacks sufficient power to puree"
Body: I just purchased this blender to replace my Hamilton Beach Scovill model 564 14-SPEED blender that I purchased in the 80's and finally the blade housing unit cracked and the bushing started deteriorating and it now leaks. I have been very happy with the blender so I purchased another Hamilton Beach blender, model 54221.Boy, what a disappointment! Even though this blender (700 WATTS) is TWICE the wattage of the Scovill model 564 (330 WATTS) it has FAR LESS power. I mainly use the blender to make green smoothies consisting of fresh spinach and kale with frozen fruit mixed in. This blender on the highest speed took 3-4 minutes to puree the greens, and even after that long, the fruit was still in chunks.And this blender is advertised as 14 functions which I interpreted to mean 14-speed like my Scovill but it only has SIX speeds... how are they getting 14 functions out of this? Are they trying to say that because each speed button is labeled with two different uses plus the two pulse buttons, they are claiming 14 functions? What a marketing SCAM. Yeah you can buy a volleyball and kick it around like a soccer ball, but that doesn't make it a volleyball and a soccer ball.I can now see from the blades on this blender why it doesn't work as good: my Scovill blender has two sets of perpendicular blades, and this blender has two sets of parallel blades fixed on top of each other.If I can't buy a better blade from Hamilton Beach, then I am going to return this. It's FAR inferior to my 30+ year old Scovill. BIG DISAPPOINTMENT!!!!

I use sliced frozen bananas and this blender even using the crushed ice setting takes way too long 2 blend the bananas and often there are big chunks left in the shake. My older blender shredded and blended the bananas quickly

Now, it’s completely useless unless I don’t mind splashing milk across my counter every time I want a shake.

I bought this as a replacement for our 10 year old cheap plastic blender that finally died. My teenager has been wanting to make smoothies, so I ordered this at Amazon's suggestion. It has done a miserable job the two times we've tried it. Both attempts required us to use a spoon and stir the fruit and juice around multiple times to get it to blend evenly. I get this isn't a Vitamix, but I'd still expect better from Hamilton Beach. Spend more and get a better blender.

Author: Tyler Bartnick
Title: Affordable blender, but lacking
Body: The blender itself is nice. I've used it almost daily since buying it, but I have noticed some drawbacks. If you just need a blender to blend smoothies and margaritas, this will definitely work. However, the drawbacks are kind of a big deal to me so I don't think I would recommend this particular model to anyone. First, all the parts that move together like gears in order to actually blend something are plastic. At first, I didn't think it would be a problem, but after the first couple of uses, you can see that the gear teeth are visibly eroding away from friction - obviously not ideal for a long term solution. Additionally, the teeth tend to leave behind a fine plastic sand all over the base of the blender as they wear away. That is probably the most annoying thing to me about this blender. They don't get in your food or drink or anything like that, but you have to clean it after every use once the teeth start to wear down. Second, the power output isn't anything special. I've had a few times already where a recipe I was following suggested I use a blender to make a puree. This blender will not be a good fit for that type of use.If you just need a basic blender, this will suffice. However, you probably shouldn't expect much else out of it.

It doesn’t matter the shape or size, anything I try to blend gets stuck at the bottom and the blades spin while everything is stuck at the corners of the vase. Please don’t buy this blender, it’s a complete waste of money!

Body: Could really only blend soft warm bananas into mush. In seconds the blade would burrow a hole in the food, and from there it would just spin, and overheat. I would not recommend people buy this blender for anything other than blending very soft drinks, preferably that don't use frozen fruit, as I found this difficult to do (taking over 5 minutes of blending for half a cup) without making the drink half milk or water.

Author: EsperanzaSN
Title: I never say this, but really - do not buy!
Body: I was looking for a heavy duty blender for smoothies, particularly to crush ice quickly. This seemed a good choice but wow am I ever disappointed. Here are the reasons:1. The mixer I feel has a design flaw. The picture has deep indentions, sort of a fluted effect, at the base. This means that all of your smoothie ingredients in. Pushed into those indentions and are completely missed by the blades.2. The blades themselves are set one on top of the other. Again this appears to be a design flaw. They should be offset so that each set is hitting your blendable ingredients differently. I thought perhaps this was something that had happened in transit and tried to correct but they are locked tight one on the other with both blade sets pointing in the same direction.All in all, a waste of money. I've tried 2 different smoothies. I tried using it to crush Ritz crackers. I even tried using it to cut up mushrooms. No matter what I put into it, all the ingredients end up pushed into those large indentions and nothing gets mixed or cut. Even fresh banana stayed whole. It's simply unusable!

Author: B.M.
Title: Pleased
Body: I’ve used this to grind everything from fruit smoothies to chicken livers. It all easily comes apart to clean and it does what I need.Probably doesn’t get as smooth as other expensive blenders like the vita mix could but hey for $30 I’m more than happy

Author: Susan
Title: Life expectancy, 3 years
Body: I purchased this blender July of 2015. It lasted until December 2018. I bought it mainly to crush ice for smoothies. I looked into several blenders before I purchased this one because I wanted to make sure it would crush ice easily. About a month ago it started smoking and smelling of burnt motor, when i used it and today it died. It was hard to take apart the base when it was time to clean and hard to remove the lid after using. While it lasted it worked well, but personally I felt it should have lasted several more years.

Author: Terra Wynkoop
Title: Perfect for smoothies.
Body: Very well made. Exactly what I was looking to buy.

Author: Retired Richard
Title: Easy to clean in dishwasher
Body: Has several settings

Author: TwinsMom
Title: Very Disappointed in the product.
Body: I had a hamilton beach blender for 37 years. It eventually quit. I purchased this blender, had it for 2 months and the base of the glass pitcher that screws on broke. I contacted HB - no response. I contacted Amazon - they told me to contact HB - I tried - no response..... Won't buy another one of these - went out and bough an Oster at Target - where I can return it and get customer service face to face.

Author: Nicole Martinez
Title: A true workout
Body:
The media could not be loaded.
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  
  
   It’s a workout to get this blender to blend food or anything in side of it. I have to stir, stop the blender, stir again and stir again while it’s blending because it doesn’t blend.I gave up on it and I’ll be purchasing another blender

Author: jamieccwocn
Title: Great blender
Body: Wonderful durable blender, very pleased

Author: Rohan K
Title: Does a very bad job blending
Body: It takes for ever for it to blend... The one job it is supposed to do

Author: LillyLilacs
Title: Live Fail!
Body: Did you see the Amazon live video demo of this product? She tried to make pesto and it wouldn't work! She tried multiple times to turn her greens and nuts into pesto but it would not blend at all. She kept adding more and more oil and remixing and finally gave up..., the video graciously cut away from the demo disaster and she hid the blender full of unblended food behind the base. I felt rather sorry for the lady doing the demo, but boy was it telling! I would not have chosen pesto for a demo, maybe it's not a bad blender.... but this was a very bad video.

Author: Christopher S.
Title: Couldn’t make a sauce on live tv
Body: I watched the new amazon infomercial where they were railing against $800 blenders stating this $30 blender could do the same thing. HOWEVER once they got the ingredients for the pesto in, the turned it on and it immediately got stuck. They cut to a static photo and when they cut back had a jar full of perfectly smooth pesto. HOWEVER the blender could still be seen behind the jar, full of non blended clogged stuff. They didn’t even have the decency to call it out and basically lied by implying that was the pesto they had just made and then continued to say there’s absolutely no difference between this $30 blender and a vitamix. Don’t lie in tv when the evidence is sitting right there.

Author: dorene
Title: So so
Body: So nice the broken one was replaced so quickly. Thank you. But... this module does not purée anything well. Even chopped up things.

Author: smk
Title: Great blender
Body: This works perfectly! I have made smoothies and milkshakes with ease. Cleaning it is easy.

Author: Maggie
Title: NICE
Body: I like that it's small and easy to fit. The color and style work great for me.

Author: Helen P. Oldershaw
Title: This is an excellent product all aroung: Hamilton Beach Wave Crusher 54220 blender
Body: This was very inexpensive, but it does everything and does it very good. I have gone through blender after blender. This is a sturdy one and it is just the right size. I can put it out of sight and get it out because it fits just right. I have used it for a dozen different things and each time I am delighted at how easy it is to use. Buy it you wont be disappointed. H. P. Oldershaw

Author: Jeff Feinsilver
Title: Great quality
Body: Great blender

Author: mildred dana
Title: Pretty and yseful
Body: Easy to use, perfect size for our needs and looks good setting on the counter.

Author: Jah
Title: Useless. Doesn't blend anything
Body: Hands down the most useless thing I've bought off Amazon. This thing can't even blend a tomato much less a smoothie. They need to market this as a noise machine.

Author: #balllikeaboss
Title: Huge disappointment
Body: This was a major disappointment. It doesn't pull the food down to the blades to chop anything up unless there's a ton of liquid or you keep pushing the food down which isn't really safe or time efficient. The blades just spin like crazy but don't blend if it's not runny. I definitely would recommend not wasting your money and getting a different one.

Author: Aaron samuels
Title: It works
Body: It cool

Author: Vickie Marsh
Title: Great Blender!
Body: My Dad (82 yrs old) uses it to prepare his health shake every morning. It blends great! There are no lumps from the bananas.

Author: Kindle Customer
Title: Anyone for a frozen strawberry daiquiri? I can make them like a pro with this.
Body: So easy to use. It makes frozen drinks like a pro. Ice cubes get broken down for drinks (which is why I wanted it) without any hiccups or sputters. For the price?? Fantastic!

Author: Kindle Customer
Title: Love my new blender. Go with the glass top, no stains!
Body: Great blender. Works perfectly and looks good too. Blended up blueberries for jelly. Love the glass top so no blueberry stains.

Author: Williams

Body: So, I should have paid more attention to the specs, but this is TINY! I thought it was a full size blender. Other than that, it gets the job done for a smoothie.

Author: Michael
Title: It only mixes liquids
Body: I had the highest hopes for this blender. It only mixes liquids. Im not sure how reviewers say it makes salsa, it doesnt. It doesnt even chop down garlic cloves. For how strong this blender is or looks to be that pretty bad. I havent tried to make smoothies but can expect much if it wont even blend veggies - in ANY of the settings.

Author: John J.
Title: It Just Works Like It Should
Body: I had a Ninja blender before and it was great, but impossible to clean and not always the best churn. This blender JUST WORKS and does it well. Easy to clean, easy to mix. Great price too. I highly recommend it.

Author: Kara W
Title: It’s great
Body: Love it

Author: felicia Chen
Title: Good quality crusher
Body: Been using this frequently for the past month, especially for making smoothies. Crushes all fruits, including apples, well and fast as well. The only minor downside is that the lid can take some time to clean.

Author: Teresa Lynn Gauthier
Title: Great blender
Body: This little blender is great has glass heavy duty bought for my son’s house while IWas visiting to make daily smoothies ! Great great blender !

Author: Katie Dyer
Title: Glass jar!!!
Body: Great blender. Super sturdy glass jar

Author: CBS
Title: Pragmatic blender
Body: I find this blender sturdy, it fits under kitchen cupboards, is easy to clean, has a useful pouring spout. Not too strong on blade action particularly on lower speeds. When I make soup that has flour and butter as well as tomatoes, I have to scrap down the material and urge it to begin blending.

Author: manatee
Title: Lightweight but works quite well
Body: OK, so this is not a Vitamix or even a Ninja, but it is quite inexpensive and works well for simple smoothies and at least it doesn't blow the lid off (even while being held down!) like the Cuisinart it replaces. It's pretty lightweight and I considered returning it for that reason and because the drive is plastic. But it works well enough and it is inexpensive!

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Maybe last blender I have to buy. Works well Reasonably priced
Body: I’ve been through 4 blenders in 18 months. All we’re duds. This looks like a keeper. Easy to clean and great power.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Nice product but seems to be having some glitches already
Body: Seems to be having a few glitches already.

Author: Jaff
Title: Great blender for less
Body: I bought this because it's glass and I'm impressed of its performance.I've been using it for 5 months now blending strawberries, mango, beets, apples... etcPlease don't compare this to +$300 Vitamix or BlendTec... That's not reasonable.This is a great blender for fruits and making smoothies...

Author: Texanlife
Title: Great blender
Body: I use this for making protein shakes. I love it! My only complaint is it is very hard to get the groove in the bottom of the pitcher clean.

Author: Yadira
Title: Cargo a la tarjeta dos veces
Body: Lo procesaron dos veces el cobro aún sale en proceso 124.79

Author: Snyder
Title: already broken
Body: I used it for puree food for a childThe motor is burnedDid not last only a few months

Author: Monica
Title: Great value, works well and lasts long
Body: I bought this back in January it is now almost the end of September and the blendor is used fairly regularly, mainly for smoothies and shakes... and it has given us no problems whatsoever! So pleased!always easy to clean and take apart and very easy to use I was a little concerned at 1st because the price, but this is was such a great buy! Absolutely would buy again.

Author: Mari
Title: Base ring breaks
Body: So I have not came been using this blender for a year and the base ring has broken in several places. The pitcher is glass which is fantastic but the base of the glass is a hard plastic which has broken into several pieces.Besides that the blending is ok. I bought it to make shakes but it does not blend the frozen strawberries completely down. I end up with chunks of strawberry in my shake.

Author: nicholas
Title: Very poor quality
Body: Only lasted 5 uses/4 months before breaking.

Author: Sheena Vega

Body: Totally does what it needs to do. Super cute size too, not too big not too small. I use it to blend coffee in the morning so it's a pretty light load but overall works great and I've loved it.

Body: Think blades are getting dull since I use it alot

Author: Sandra Johnson
Title: Love everything about this blender!
Body: It has been a long time since I purchased a new blender. I absolutely Love this blender and would highly recommend it!

Author: Stevie Wilson
Title: Wider Base, Shorter Cup Makes a MUCH More Stable Blender!
Body: This wide base blender is a wonderful tool. I never liked really tall blender cups because they would travel across the countertop. This Hamilton Beach Blender has a variety of settings and a much wider base and shorter cup so that it's easier to add ingredients to the container. I like how effective it is at chopping up ice too!

Author: Owner
Title: Not great for frozen fruit or ice
Body: This blender seems durable, but not when making smoothies with frozen fruit or blending ice. The photograph with ice and fruit is not what this blender is suited for. It may work well for soft substances, but I replaced it quick because it wasn't up to the task of making smoothies. I often had to open the lid and push the frozen fruit down with a spoon. If I didn't do that the blades would spin quite fast and the motor would start to smell. I had my doubts this would last and I did not want to risk it burning up so I purchased a Ninja blender. I wish I hadn't wasted my money on this since I like to make smoothies. Luckily it was inexpensive.

Author: jack w ross
Title: Just the right one
Body: This product came as ordered and was just the right one.

Author: ELIZABETH DILLOW

Body: Very versatile. Makes Great smoothies. So far so good

Author: Vanessa Gutierrez

Body: It looks good, but there are times when blending it makes you think the blades are not sharp at all.

Author: Joe G
Title: Doesn’t blend well
Body: It’s a nice looking blender, super easy on clean up, but the lid is hard to get off and it down right doesn’t blend well. I get skins, seeds, and chunks no matter how long I blend. I’ve been juicing and drinking smoothies for decades, since joe the juicer lol! This just doesn’t do the job.

Title: Cheap parts and this wavemotion" thing doesn't blend well at all."

The last time I used it all the ingredients spilled out all over the blender! What could have been an easy fix has now rendered the entire blender useless. Don't buy this.

Author: Will

Body: Not worth it at all. All I had in it was powder and liquids and it couldn’t even move them. Essentially it just spun on the bottom piece until the motor started to burn out. Don’t waste your money on this.

Author: G523
Title: Excellent Performance
Body: This is the best blender I ever had hands down. I love the self cleaning option, especially because I have a small dishwasher. It is great for blending frozen fruits because it has two sets of blades in the bottom. The only thing I would change is Hamilton Beach’s limited warranty. I honestly wish they would stand by their products more, especially if you’re willing to invest in a quality blender.

Author: `Ben Ansley
Title: For liquids, not solids
Body: I bought this blender as a temporary until my vita-mix was repaired. Obviously I didn’t expect it to come close to performing like the vita mix but expected it to blend up veggies and fruit for smoothies and baby food. It took me 15 minutes to make a smoothie. Maybe something about the configuration of blades but they sling the food to the outside of the pitcher almost immediately and you have constantly push the food to the center. Extremely frustrating. I definitely would not recommend this blender. We through ours away after a week.

Author: Racquel Lee
Title: Three Stars
Body: Item appeared used and dirty :(

Author: Krystina Baez

Body: Terrible blender.. The blades are so small that it takes forever to blend smoothies.

Author: Margie
Title: Beautiful and powerful blender but only 7 speeds, not 14 as advertised.
Body: When I first saw in the description that it had 14 blending functions, I was super excited to blend smoothies and the like with mega-power. I had a Hamilton Beach multi-function blender before and it really did have 12 speeds. Come to see that it was not so in this one. There's really no 14 blending functions but rather 7, hence the 4 stars. This was not necessarily a bad thing but I was a little disappointed. However, this is indeed a beautiful blender with enough power to blend well. I love it!!

Author: PH
Title: Very disappointed. Hamilton Beach used to make reliable products
Body: I bought this last year. Don't blend much. Wanted to mix some onions and herbs into hamburger to make a paste. Put in the ingredients, about 1/4 full, put on the lid. Set it to blend and it ran about 10 seconds and smoke came out the base and that was it. The model and series I think are 54220 and A2971CE (white lettering on the base). It was made in China. It was about $28 so I wasn't expecting much, but I wasn't expecting a fire hazard.Very disappointed. Hamilton Beach used to make reliable products.
