Author: Stella W.
Title: Doesn't do a very good job of breaking down foods
Body: Doesn't do a very good job of breaking down foods. My mini food processor does a better job. I was looking for a larger sized appliance but this one missed the mark on mincing and blending.

Author: Plumpkin
Title: Not a general purpose blender
Body: This device may be fine for making smoothies, but I don't. Because of the gap between the bottom on the blade and the bottom of the vase if you are making a sauce ingredients, e.g., honey, spices, tend to settle below the bottom of the blades and not get incorporated.

Author: Ani
Title: Great blender, great price
Body: I make a breakfast smoothie a few times a week with my blender and I'm very satisfied with it. I've had it for about a month now and it gets the job done. I've never owned a nutribullet, so i can't compare the quality, but for the price it's a good deal.

Author: Jaxenfeld
Title: I’m sure it’s fine for softer jobs like milk shakes and sauces / ...
Body: Does not even remotely crush ice. Disappointing. I’m sure it’s fine for softer jobs like milk shakes and sauces / dressings

Author: Martha Teklu
Title: Some part of this blender is missing. I blended ...
Body: Some part of this blender is missing. I blended some fruits and juice and when picked it out of the base, I spilled the whole thing because parts are missing to keep it in the container.

Author: SummerLove 247
Title: Great Blender, just not for me
Body: Actually a great blender, but I since I use my blender so much and I like to make hummus etc. needs to be creamy… It’s a little hard getting everything smooth.

Author: Eric
Title: Received this as a gift and it does a great job of blending my frozen drinks
Body: Received this as a gift and it does a great job of blending my frozen drinks. Have had it for over a year now and it still works great. Not the highest quality blender but definitely worth the price.

Author: Angela
Title: Unhappy with purchase!
Body: I attempted several times to make my daiquiris and this blender has failed each and every time! It comes out frothy and not frozen. I’ve followed the directions and it still came out that way. I’ve tried how I normally make it on my older blender and it still came out frothy and liquidy. Not only that but I can’t make a large batch at a timesince it’s so small. Upset with this purchase and even more upset that if I wanted to return I would have to pay for the shipping fees. Waste of my money and energy. Now I have a blender that sucks!

Author: Melissa Hirsch
Title: I would give this 0 stars if I could. ...
Body: I would give this 0 stars if I could. Broke within a few weeks and even though I bought the 3 year warranty, I was still charged $11.99 for shipping to replace it. Don't buy anything from Hamilton Beach!!!

Author: George Washington
Title: One Star
Body: Arrived with cracked base, which leaked. Will see how replacement is. .... The replacement arrive promptly , but the base which is poorly designed with cheap plastic, cracked in multiple places with simple daily use blending liquids(not even hard stuff). There's no use replacing something that is poorly designed again. If you use this product more than 14 times, it is likely to break. I wo'nt be buying anything Hamilton Beach again. I replaced it with a different Brand on the shelf at Target.

Author: Cindy B
Title: Hamilton Beach Wave Crusher -
Body: Wonderful blender, extremely powerful. Love the built in attached gasket. I am very pleased with Hamilton Beach items and this one is no exception.

Author: Ed Johnson
Title: Three Stars
Body: Already broke.

Author: couldbutwont
Title: Worked for several months and then died
Body: I used this daily for smoothies and it worked ok. Not great just ok. Now I can't get it to blend frozen fruit. It started to smell like it was burning so I figured the motor was dead and tossed it right out. Would not buy another Hamilton Beach product.

Body: Works fine even with ice. Top needs to be held down since it can come off during smoothie making.

Body: Excellent for the price. Works very well. I just forget the noise level of blenders

Author: Richard Legg Benavides
Title: Busted
Body: The blender itself works well and I like the glass jar. However, the plastic bottom where you screw into the blender cracked the first time I used it. It continued to crack until it totally fell apart. Now I have a blender but can't use it. :(

Author: Moe
Title: Great buy!
Body: An absolute must buy! I love that you don't have to remove the lid to pour. There's already a little opening on the lid for that. Great quality. Easy to use and clean. We make smoothies everyday and this the nest blender ever. Oh it's also nice and wide! Love it!

Body: I enjoy making smoothies in my blender. It’s so easy to clean out, also.

Author: Louis in CT
Title: Great product
Body: Great product

Author: Diane Miessler
Title: Just doesn't work; leaves big chunks of carrots I'm trying to puree.
Body: I just bought a different blender because this one doesn't do what I want a blender to do. Yesterday I put in a handful of carrots with enough water to cover them, trying to puree them to add to a sauce. After about 5 minutes of starting, stopping and pushing down the carrots into the blades with a spoon, starting, repeat ad infinitum, I had some pureed carrots and lots of marble-size-or-bigger chunks of carrots.Pureeing a handful of carrots doesn't seem like a Herculean task for a blender, but something about the design of this one makes it not work.

Author: rachel obrien
Title: Three Stars
Body: Cheap and quick blender on a budget

Author: Craig C.
Title: Great unit for the $$$
Body: Still blending away daily!

Author: NY resident

Body: The motor stopped running in one month and came back. Four months later now, it does not run anymore. Doubt the quality of the blender motor.

Title: Five Stars
Body: works well

Author: Deklyn
Title: Works great!
Body: My Ninja blender is too strong and won't blend smoothies because the powder doesn't pull down to mix. This works perfectly and once running you can remove the top and add more stuff which you cannot do with the ninja smoothies container.

Author: Heather
Title: Five Stars

Author: Amazon_Customer

Body: Works well! Ice, fruits, vegetables, all delicious and quick done. I had a Nutribullet before, and compared just the price of both you save a lot of money. This one is until now for me same as the Nutribullet. It makes the same smoothies ;)

Body: Worked great for 2 years,then the plastic gears on the lower portion disintegrated making it unusable. It was used only periodically! Should have lasted much longer!

Body: Good job crushing ice but have pnly used about 12 times in a year and plastic bottom just split. Lemonade everywhere. It happened when I was taking it out of the base.

Author: curlupanddye
Title: Doesn't Do It's Main Purpose: BLEND
Body: I blend stuff all the time: Salsas, smoothies, hummus, margaritas, you name it; it goes in the blender. No matter if I set it to the highest setting, for the love of got it does not blend my food. I was very upset! I even specifically bought glass since I make a lot of salsa, so that the garlic doesn't seep into the plastic. Mehh, I am not a happy lil lady.

Both times I put some liquid in first as recommended. The glass jar is very heavy. I don’t use a blender often so that is why I purchased this one as it was under $30 and claimed to crush ice.

Author: Lauren Seppala
Title: Quiet - Tough - Well Built - Super Affordable
Body: As soon as this blender showed up at my house today I started making frappes. Man, to be so affordable this thing rocks. It's not overly loud, but not super quiet. It doesn't even come close to the sound of your average vacuum cleaner. I have now used it a total of 4 times in under 1 hour. It crushed 2 cups of ice to the perfect consistency of a frappe (or smoothie).No smoking as mentioned in other reviews. There were no crazy noises. The glass on the blender is high-quality and quite thick. The lid secures well without any wiggle room. It arrived on time and in neat packaging. I'm definitely wondering why I've never owned a blender until now. This blender now has a permanent space of my kitchen counter. Love it!

Author: Edgar
Title: terrible for small batches
Body: I have grown to hate this thing. I typically do small batches and this thing does that super poorly. It is also relatively difficult to clean. Unless there is a large amount of material, the blades simply fling all of the material to the side and nothing happens. You have to push the material back down over and over. As it starts to chop it, then you can shake the blender while it is running. I have an Oster that is otherwise very similar except that it does a great job with small batches. That is because the lower pair of blades are much lower and the material cannot escape by sitting below the blades, and that material forces the stuff that would sit on the sides to keep moving.

I make smoothies every day as well as make almond milk once a week, so I was putting waaay too much strain on the motor.I ended up gifting this to my brother’s girlfriend and got something a bit heftier. Not the blenders fault at all. Again, good for light to medium use.

If it doesn't last, although I'm sure it will, I could replace it 4 to 6 times and still be ahead. This is a solid, powerful blender. I love the secure top with a flap to add and spout with a cover flap to pour. The only drawback is the faux stainless panel around the buttons. For an extra buck this could be metal.

Author: T. Ranson
Title: It's a decent blender for the price, but they will make you keep on paying.
Body: True story: Bought a blender from Hamilton Beach (through Amazon). Excellent blender, best ever for the price which was under $35. The little plastic ring broke that holds the blades to the glass. It's a nothing little piece of plastic, the least sophisticated part on the blender. Even though it's under warranty (6 months old) Hamilton Beach wants $5.99 to ship it to me. I wanted to get an extra since this obviously is a part that will fail repeatedly. They offered an extra for $5.99 + another additional $5.99 shipping. That's almost half the cost of the ENTIRE BLENDER. For a small plastic ring. Listen, I like the blender, but the warranty policy is a rip off, and the idea that you pay double the price for slow (10 day) shipping on a piece of plastic is just stupid. I even offered to buy an extra, just put it in the same shipment, NOPE, they want double the price of the part for shipping for each piece. This is the last HB blender I buy.

Author: MotoBonnie
Title: Very pleased with this inexpensive blender
Body: Very pleased with this inexpensive blender. After 6 months, I've been pleasantly surprised with its blending ability and options. I use it daily for my smoothies which always consist of frozen fruit and greens. If you follow the directions and put your liquids in first, followed by yogurt/etc, and finally frozen on top, it does the trick. Very happy I was able to spend a fraction of the price on a blender that's actually working for me.

Title: Nice Blender at a Reasonable Price
Body: I bought my Hamilton Beach blender six months ago to primarily make smoothies & I've been very pleased with it. It does a terrific job with the various frozen fruits & ice I use. The pour lid is great - far less mess than other blenders I've used. One thing to keep in mind is the jar is glass & quite heavy. If you or the person you're purchasing this for has neurological problems or difficulties with hand strength, this might be something to take into account. After nearly dropping it the first week, I bought some tennis grip gauze tape, wrapped it around the handle & it worked like a charm. I use my blender daily - clean up is easy & I haven't had a problem with it being slippery since.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Decent Blender, Terrible Lid
Body: The only thing that really gets me about this blender is the lid. The lid is super thin/cheap plastic, it fits so tightly around the pitcher that it is difficult to take the lid off without sloshing your smoothie when the pitcher is anywhere close to full, and the no mess pouring spout.First off, I've never had difficulty pouring from any blender I've owned. And none of them came with this terrible spout. Secondly, if your pulsing with the pitcher over half full, the contents will shoot up to the closed spout, and drip out the sides. The spout is super annoying to clean by hand as well.Besides the lid I'd say it's a decent blender, especially for under $40. It has enough power for most things, it isn't terribly noisy, mixes everything pretty nicely without pulsing all day and it's a fairly big pitcher. Good Lord that lid though.

Author: Gabriella Lopez
Title: Safer than the NINJA, and blends amazingly!
Body: So far so great. I really went back and forth doing research for a good blender and I was torn between this one and the Ninja. However from the reviews you can see that the Ninja can be dangerous and knowing how clumsy I am that stopped me from buying it. Also I watched video reviews of the ninja and it seems like it didn't blend well enough, however, this blender blends AMAZINGLY. I chose this one because it seemed like the best choice as far as consistency goes and the price is wonderful so if it stops working in a year or two years (I make smoothies on a daily basis) then it's priced well enough that I could just replace it with a new one every year or 2. This blender's settings are great, it has no trouble blending frozen fruits or ice and my smoothies taste amazing. It blends my protein powder well so it doesnt get stuck on the sides and doesn't clump up in my smoothie. SO happy with this purchase, and I appreciate that the blades won't fall out and cut my fingers.

I don't use frozen fruit (fresh fruit only-cut up into pieces) and I use small ice cubes, not the big blocks you usually get from ice trays. So far, I've had NO issues with this blender. Blends everything, no chunks and the pouring spout is great. I've also used it few times, and haven't experienced any issues. For the price, it's a good blender.

Author: Nicole Casi
Title: Not quite the wave I anticipated...
Body: Ok, so after reading multiple raving reviews on this product, I anticipated a blender capable of whipping up a good hummus or smoothie. Nope. It took over 5 minutes to make a smoothie with frozen fruit, and there was nothing smooth about; it was super chunky. The same thing happened when I added a can of chickpeas with water, olive oil and tahini. It took over 20 minutes with repeated stirring to move the heavier pieces toward the blade and many pauses so as to not burn the motor out. The whip puree button seemed to work better than the smoothie and crushed-ice ones, but my result, after much labor and time, was something consistent with extra crunchy peanut butter. I kept adding water to make it less thick, and thus perhaps more easily blendable, but that didn't seem to help much as I ended up with super soupy, crunchy hummus. Perhaps, I got a lemon, but given the reviews, I anticipated something far better than this. My old blender died, so I am currently using my mother's vintage one from 1970, and, sad to say, it works as effectively as the Hamilton Beach Wave Crusher I tried.

Body: While there are some definite PROS (thick glass container, sturdy lid that fits snugly, ease of attaching container to base, snap tight spout for adding liquid or small ingredients while blending), the one big CON is that it doesn't do a good job. In my experience, it actually just blends; in the same way that a whisk would do. I'm a big fan of low budget blenders; they work for my simple needs. I just need it to make smoothies from both frozen ingredients & fresh. I always add plenty of liquid, so that's not an issue. The issue is this just can't handle blending ingredients in a non-chunky way. Will be returning.

Author: Gigi
Title: The Blender that can't blend
Body: I bought this for making salsas, blending cocktails, and thicker smoothies for smoothie bowls. This machine is useless and regret not returning it earlier. It is aesthetically a good looking blender but that is about it. I tried to make a smoothie this morning with a handful of ice and frozen blueberries, half a banana and 4 fresh strawberries with almond milk. The blender managed to chop some of the banana and strawberries but the blade was not able to continue blending the rest of the fruit and ice even after I stopped the blender and moved the items around. I ended up dumping the contents into my nutribullet and it was done in seconds. I dumped the icy smoothie back into the blender (after it was already blended) but it was not strong enough to mix the contents. Really?! A brand new blender can't mixed already mixed contents?! This is a joke

Author: Coursing Rivers
Title: Design flaws making blending an adventure
Body: I bought this because of the large jar capacity. I use my blender strictly for pureeing sauces, smoothies, cream soups, etc. Unfortunately, the size isn't much of a benefit because filling the jar even 3/4 full means the contents at the top don't get blended well.Everyone knows glass is heavy, and this jar is as well, making it more difficult to lift, scrape, and pour from. I would have preferred a plastic jar, but those were only available in smaller sizes.My biggest gripe, though, is the lid. The first time I used it, the contents sprayed up and forced the spout open slightly, dribbling sauce (that happened to be hot) all over the lid and even up onto my face. There's another flap on the lid and that shot open as well. When I twisted the jar off the base, the bottom came unscrewed and fell out. So that was a fine mess on the countertop.To use this, I need to make sure to re-tighten the base before adding anything to the jar, only fill it halfway, then hold down both the spout and the flap on the lid while blending. Kind of a hassle. It also doesn't puree very finely. If my food processor is worst at pureeing and my Bullet is best, this is somewhere in the middle.

Body: I have not used it yet, but I did turn it on. It is kinda loud, but I would say not much louder than my old blender. The reason I chose this one is because the base of the blender is wide, not tapered like most and like my old one. I really was assuming and thinking mine sucked at crushing ice because it was not getting to the bottom of the blender. This one boasts a lot about its power and ability to crush ice, so it better work. the lid, as other reviews state, is hard to get on and off, but as they said I am hoping it will loosen over time. The quality from further away looks wonderful, but upon close up inspection, it seems pretty cheap. The lid most of all. nice features, but you pay cheap you get cheap. has a 3 year warranty but does not include the glass (really?) or normal wear and tear and the manual states that this item is subject to normal wear and tear just from using it so it seems like warranty isn't much. the most quality of this is the glass so maybe that's is why you don't need a warranty on it. Good feature - you can just put the blender on it and turn it on - does not need to be locked into a certain position to turn on - you know that in older products is annoying right!?!

Yes, you should keep a spoon close by to mix your frozen stuff so the blades can get ahold of them (turn the blender off before you do this!). It's no Vitamix, but at less than a 1/10th the price, it's a huge bargain. Oh, and the carafe and lid are dishwasher safe!

Title: Like it but it came apart after one week!
Body: I like it BUT ... after a week it broke! The blue plastic thingie that attached to the base which the glass top sits on came off while mixing a shake! It wasn't cracked or broken but it came loose and a washer was sticking up on the screw it was supposed to fit on. Hubby tried and tried to put it back together but the washer didn't give the plastic thingie room to be tightened down. So he took the washer off and tightened the blue plastic thingie down and it's worked fine...so far. The glass is nice and thick and the whole thing seems sturdy so I am puzzled why the little blue plastic thing came off. I loved our old, old Hamilton Beach blender and we replaced the blades more than once but decided to retire it as it look pretty beat up. I hope this Wave Crusher lasts ...we'll see.

Title: Product arrived Dead on Arrival
Body: Product arrived DOA from Amazon Warehouse Deals. The blades in the jar spun for a few seconds before the motor in the base began making a grinding noise. Smoke was then emitted from the base as well as an electric burning smell. Black marks were also left on my counter from the base feet. I have already filed for an exchange. Will update when the new one arrives.Update: New one arrived a few days ago. Made several different smoothies with it. Everything works, but the speed differences aren't all that noticeable. Going from the highest speed to the lowest I can tell a drop in speed but it's not as big as I thought it would be. The pulse buttons are nothing more than buttons that don't stay depressed. The pulse feature means you press the putt on for a second and then let go to stop it. Overall, I'm not too impressed with this. One extra star for Amazon getting me a replacement quickly.

Author: CHB
Title: Toy Story Blender
Body: As a professional recipe developer, I have a lot of kitchen gadgets. I purchased this blender to use for small jobs that don't require the intensity of more powerful machines that require more counter space and cleanup. The blender was delivered in mid-September and I used it for the first time mid-November. After adding Greek yogurt, a fully ripened avocado, some fresh herbs and lime juice, I turned it on. After blending, scraping the sides, blending again and repeating the process, I checked the contents. Chunks of avocado were on the sides and the entire mixture was not blended as much as if I had stirred it a bowl. After pulsing, using every setting and speed and way too much time for such a task, I gave up and just blended my recipe with a spoon. The blades do turn when the machine is on, but they are very dull. Plastic knives are sharper. Rather than use this for any real kitchen duty, it is probably best suited for a child's play kitchen toy since there is no danger any fingers could be cut with these blades.

Title: For the price this is a fantastic blender. It blends everything very fine (if you ...

Author: Veronica
Title: A Good Starter Blender
Body: For the price, I'm not sure it can get any better! I haven't used any other blenders, but basically every blog and recipe site out there will tell you that you simply cannot make a good smoothie if you don't have a big-name $400 blender. Wrong-o. This thing purees frozen fruits and greens just fine. You may have to use a little more liquid than the recipe calls, but I've had no trouble making smooth, creamy, delicious smoothies. Just a hint, banana, avocado, nut butters, and yogurt can thicken up your smoothie a bit to compensate for extra liquid. I've just been throwing random crap in the blender, really, peeping at recipes for ideas. Haven't made a bad one yet. It does struggle a bit with frozen fruits, but I've found that cutting them up into smaller chunks really helps out. I do chop my kale pretty well, but whole spinach leaves and herb sprigs are just fine. Having to chop before blending may bother some, but I don't mind at all. Just don't expect to throw a whole frozen banana in there and it be okay (although a whole room-temp banana does blend!) I think this is the perfect blender to purchase if you want to get your feet wet in smoothie-making without shelling out hundreds of dollars. You really can't beat the price for what you get.

Title: Doesn't Match Up to It's Name or Guarantees!!!
Body: I wish I could return this item but it's been after the 30 days but I was trying to give it a chance. I bought it to make smoothies which when I researched these types of items this was considered one of the best. It does not crush the ice like it states and I have to open it up and stir it 3 or 4 times to get it to a smoother consistency. And as far as the spout on the top, it's non functional to pour anything out of and you have to make sure the top is pushed down all the way which is hard to tell at times. I am very dissapointed in this product and wish items such as this that did not function as they have listed on the box, descriptions and instructions could be returned if they do not meet the customers standards. A 30 day return policy sometimesjust isn't enough time to give a fair assesment of certain items such as this one. .

I make smoothies daily and if I just add the ingredients and turn on the blender (a process that always worked with other cheap blenders) the ingredients just sit there while the blades whirl furiously to no effect. I have to lift it, shake it around, rearrange the ingredients and eventually it will blend. I am shopping for a new blender.

I wish the jar held more, but for most homes it is a great size and I just make more than one batch when I need greater volume. It is kind of noisy but it IS a blender after all. It only gets four stars but it isn't meant to be a five star blender. It comes apart completely for cleaning and stands up fine to the high heat industrial dish machine I use to wash it. The flip top pour spot is a nice feature and the ingredients swirl nicely bottom to top for even mixing.

And if your friends like mocha make it a dark chocolate mocha with cocoa powder and a maybe a third of a packet of dark chocolate hot cocoa powder. Yum!If this review helped you, please click yes.

Body: Everything about this blender has been great! We do smoothies every morning, and I love the lid! It makes pouring so much easier, and it blends really nicely! The body is sturdy, and ivlove the base is harder to rip over. For the price this is pretty on point!EDIT: not two months later the blender glass is broken :( we've been taking really good care of it, and a small tink broke the whole base. Super bummed.

Author: Scott
Title: Great frozen smoothies. Better than blenders that cost triple this one!
Body: I've tried many blenders and this one does a fantastic job for sooo much less money. I bought it for a vacation home and liked it so much I bought another one to replace ours at home. I'm actually buying this again after having it over 2 years and leaving a spoon in it by mistake which stripped the gears. So yes, the gears are plastic and you can't blend spoons! But I blended ice every morning for 2 years without a problem, and let's face it, buying a blender with metal gears will cost a ton more, and the metal gears are made of zinc which is actually a softer metal than high-end plastics. I'm not saying these gears are high-end plastic, I have no idea, but I can replace this every time I leave a spoon in it and still save money... Also, I blend my smoothies VERY thick. So thick they usually won't come out of the blender without the help of a spoon or at least a lot of shaking. So yes, since I barely use any liquid, I need to know the tricks of how to blend ice. You can't just press a button and walk away, which isn't any different from ANY blender under $200. You need to start out just tapping the pulse button and occasionally shaking the blender until you get the contents rolling, and THEN you can press the slow button and every few seconds hit the next button up until you have a super smooth smoothie. Oh, and one last tip - I used to think it did a fantastic job at blending ice for such an inexpensive blender, but then I took the blades out and used my steak knife sharpener to sharpen the blades just a tiny bit. Not enough to make them thin like the blades in the nutri-bullet or anything, I didn't want them thin and likely to chip, I still wanted the edge to be a wedge and not a blade. But just that little bit of sharpening did the trick and my frozen smoothies are SO INCREDIBLY SMOOTH now. Try it...

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: great, affordable ice crusher!
Body: I'm very satisfied with the performance of this blender. I wanted a blender for smoothies or frozen drinks, so it had to be good crushing ice. this blender handles ice well, and for the price I'm quite pleased! I just wasn't crazy about the the upside down, make one drink at a time, costs $150 blender. I just wanted a traditional blender and one that I could serve several people at once if i wanted too, or add stuff in the middle without tipping upside down, or worrying about leakage, and one that was affordable! I like the spout for pouring neatly. Smoothies come out smooth, not with big chunks, so long as you blend it long enough (about 1 minute). It is loud like other reviews said so keep that in mind. So long as this blender lasts a while, i'm going to be very happy with it.

Title: Works good enough for me
Body: For thirty-five dollars, this blender does the job for me. I use it once a day in the morning. I put fruit juice, frozen fruit, and sometimes yogurt in it & it blends it pretty well. Yes, it's noisy, and yea sometimes there are little chunks of the frozen fruit left in it. If you don't want that, spend three hundred dollars for the top of the line ones. I really don't see the point of having that flip top pouring spout in the lid. I have yet to use it as I blend whatever I'm blending & remove the whole top & pour into glass. You have to remove the top anyway to clean it, so the flip cap is kinda useless for me. If It lasts a year without breaking, it's worth the price. There are much better blenders out there for much more money.

Title: Works Perfectly for Frozen Smoothies

Body: I really like this blender. It has multiple settings and I use it every morning for my smoothies. You can see the wave as they call it while the blending is taking place. I have had no problems so far with this product and it was a great price. I would recommend this blender if you don't want to spend a great deal of money on a blender. I'm not a serious blender user but this model suffices my need and does a wonderful job at it.

Author: Jill
Title: Not a Quality" Blender"
Body: To be fair, I gave it 3 stars because It does actually work. However don't expect it to work quickly or without extra prep. I bought this blender to replace my 10 year old blender (maybe even older than that since it was my mother-in-law's blender). Anyway, with my old blender (R.I.P) I could toss in cubes of fruit/veggies, ice, yogurt all at the same time and get a smooth blend in less than 2 minutes, every time! This Hamilton Beach Wave Crusher...? It will not blend at all UNLESS you cut the fruit/veggies very VERY small. And even after that, you have to keep stopping the blender and stiring the fruit to make sure its getting its chance in the chooper. It takes like 10 minites to finally get a smooth sound of blending. And even after all that hard work, you're still left with pieces of fruit in your smoothie! So EXHAUSTING!! Next time, I will kick out the extra bucks and buy a more expensive blender because CLEARLY, there is a difference.

Thus, much opening, rearranging, stirring, scraping down etc. is required. Ill either order a pair of replacement blades that are designed for normal use of a blender or just send it back.For a nominal price increase, Manufacturer could have easily included two sets of blades to create a very nice, very multifunctional unit.

Ice cubes and big frozen strawberries are a little bit of a challenge for it just like my old one. But at least it was cheap and it's not leaking and is prettier. :) Good for a basic blender. The lid is not an issue as other reviewers stated. The size is nice.

Author: Rachel
Title: Simply Doesn't Blend!!
Body: This blender is terrible. I have used it twice and I'm sending it back. I bought it exclusively for smoothies/shakes and it simply could not handle it. Putting a banana, liquid, ice, spinach, and water ... A fairly basic smoothly - and the blender couldn't grab anything into the blades. I had to open the lid multiple times (which seals REALLY well - great if you don't have to keep taking it on and off, but in this case, a royal pain) and using a spoon to try and smash the ingredients into the blades. It took forever and was more trouble than it's worth. Tried again this morning. Not a blender you want to deal with while trying to make breakfast and get out the door.Don't bother. Not a good blender.

Body: Bought this blender a little while back. This is a very nice blender for the money. I use it to make veggie shakes, I use frozen vegetables. It has no problem liquefying them, just make sure you add a healthy dose of liquid if you don't want to have a paste. The self cleaning feature works good, just do it as soon as you make your veggie shake. It was very well packed, had a hard time getting it out because it was so well packed. I am very pleased with this blender so far. I will come back with updates as I own this blender. Oh and the glass pitcher is thick, it ain't no crappy plastic one, and this lid is probably the best sealing lid I every had on a blender. Highly recommend.

Author: Michelle

Body: I love it! Great for smoothies!

The buttons don't work very fluidly and there's not much difference between each blend setting, the lid is incredibly hard to get off, and worst of all the pouring spout is terrible and doesn't pour without running down the side of the blender. Author: Grinning Fox
Title: ... little over a month ago and so far so good! The only downside is that it's quite loud
Body: Bought this blender a little over a month ago and so far so good! The only downside is that it's quite loud, my fiance has expressed annoyance at being startled awake at 5:15 in the morning when I make my smoothies for breakfast before work so I've opted for making them the night before. The blades are sharp and handle ice cubes with ease, no large clumps to speak of. I read reviews about the cap being difficult to remove but a little common sense makes that a non issue. Just don't mash it on over the glass, put it on lightly. It's really only there to keep liquid from spewing everywhere after all and honestly the spout feature on the lid isn't really necessary since the pitcher also pours in a very neat and precise stream, assuming whatever you're blending isn't super thick. For the price it's a very good blender assuming it holds out for at least a few years.

It does have a 3 year manufacturer's warranty, plus if you use a credit card you can get an additional year (on most credit cards).

Author: Active Man
Title: Good quality, powerful, turns Kale to liquid
Body: Our old American-made blender, handed down from the sixties, started leaking. The seal had degraded over the years. No replacements could be found. The Wave Crusher had good reviews and the price was reasonable. There are lots of reviews so I will jump right to things we like.The glass pitcher is nice because it cleans up easy. Plastic can shrink or deform over time. This can lead to poorly sealing threads and gaskets if you plan on keeping the blender for years and years. Plastic will also develop tiny cracks and crevices that trap food particles, glass will not. Yes, probably nothing really to worry about but it is true.The lid fits tightly. It requires some wiggling to pop it off. This is good because the tight lid allows you to pour the pitcher without leaks, drips or the lid flying off when you tilt it.The motor runs smoothly compared to the old US-made blender. I imagine the gears are finer and don't grind as much. My wife makes iquid breakfast drinks made from kale, powder mix, fruits (frozen and fresh), soy milk and ice cubes (sometimes). The blender is able to mix, blend, crush all these foods nicely. The kale is converted into a drinkable liquid. I can hear the motor respond to frozen fruits and ice cubes but the blender easily handles this load.Clean-up can be a simple rinse. I often twist off the base and pop out the blades. It is easy to do.Overall I think this blender is a good value and does what it claims. Time will tell if the motor and blades last but that will depend a lot on what we throw at this blender. Grinding ice cubes is probably the most stressful job for a blender motor and blades. For basic home use this blender is a winner.

I cut the vegetables up into small pieces before putting them into the blender and I add some liquid, but it's still a struggle, though I have managed to get it to do the task each time in the end. (The more liquid the better, it seems.) It may well be that NO blender will really do a terrific job with this chore. Apart from this issue, I have no complaints about the blender. Would I buy it again? Open question, but I would probably be inclined to try another one to see if it worked better.

Body: . I like the pitcher it opens and cleans easily it stores easy and doesn't take up much space. I have to shove the fruit around with a knife so that it would blend. eventually it blended a little but I was still left with some milk in the bottom of the glass that didn't blend. I want to send t his back as defective it doesn't do what it says it does. I saw a wave action once and it was weird. and it was only after everything was completely liquid. if you want this fro crushed ice or smoothies, it won't work. go get another bleneder. I have an off brand blender I have had for ten years, it works better than this one.not to mention the fact I got hurt twice trying to get the lid off the pitcher it's so tight it flings off when you get it off. the smoothie top doesn't work very well either.

Author: Jack of all Trades
Title: This blender taught me how to hate.
Body: This blender taught me rage. I didn't know I could hate an inanimate object with so much passion before I started using this blender. I used to think that kind of hate was reserved for Nazis and University of Florida fans only, but no, I now can say I truly know myself better due to the experiences I've had with this blender.Let's start with the blending option. I think if you wanted to mix food dye in with some water you might be able to after 20 or 30 minutes of blending, but ice? Ha! Smoothies? Think again sucker! Whipped cream? More like stirred froth. See, when the masochistic designers unzipped their leather masks and peeled back their eye patches long enough to settle on giving this thing a function they discovered what might be one of the single greatest designs in all of the history of futility. This blender can mysteriously mix the areas in contact with the blades with extreme prejudice while leaving any areas of liquid or substance above the blades completely unperturbed. Amazingly this blender can render ice at the bottom into pure liquid water in seconds while leaving the ice above more frozen than Elsa's underwear.Some of you might be thinking well just push the other stuff down dummy and you'd be right if this weren't designed by Pol Pot clones raised in Chinese sweat shops. Pushing things down just begins the second round of mushed on the bottom and solid on the top. Now, given 30 or 40 minutes of free time you might be able to eventually go through enough cycles of this to get everything in the blender mixed, and kudos to you buddy for having the patience and virtue to go through that process. I lack these virtues, which is why I bought a blender that I was hoping would cut down on my smoothie making time. It did what I did not think was possible, which was add time to an already laborious process of making smoothies by hand.The lid requires a degree in mechanical engineering to get on and off smoothly, which is great if you enjoy splashing your kitchen with blender contents, but my wife is the lead cleaning manager of our kitchen and I'm pretty sure I'd be restricted from all kitchen privileges if I continued opening the pseudo-smoothies I've been making without covering myself and the blender in a beach towel first. I hate laundry so I'm going to pass on the extra towel duty. Amazingly my wife hates this blender even more than I do; when I asked her if she wanted to contribute to the review she asked me how to spell a 10 minute scream. I'm pretty sure she put an add on Craiglist for a hitman to come by and take this thing out.If I could give this thing less than 1 star I would, but then again if I could give this thing Ebola I would do that also. I hereby sentence this blender to the death of a thousand hammer smashes, I would not dare allow someone else to attempt to use it lest I be tried for crimes against humanity (which I think the UN Council may need to consider for Hamilton Beach).

Author: Kindle Customer
Title: it has an unnecessary flap, not even mentioned in the instruction booklet
Body: I bought this to replace a twenty year old Oster blender that started to leak. I only use it to make banana smoothies. Sorry I bought it. The cover is extremely difficult to remove. Then, it has an unnecessary flap, not even mentioned in the instruction booklet, that is impossible to close. It has a pouring spout so there is no need for this flap. It requires a full cup of liquid to work. This waters down a smoothie. You have to hold the flap closed while it blends and then you can barely get the top off. Just awful. I would return it but I figured, what could go wrong with a blender? So I immediately threw the box out. Poorly designed solidly made piece of junk.

VERY easy to clean, use, and enjoy. I highly recommend. You cannot do better for the price.

Body: I love the blender, have owned it for about 3 weeks now. Only one problem the base that screws onto the glass container comes VERY tight. Trying to remove it I could feel the plastic starting to bend. What worked for me is add: ice, salt, 1-2 inches of water into the glass container. Wait 20-30 seconds, empty. This will cause the glass to contract slightly and loosen up. After that it came off without too much of a problem.

Title: Its good just a simple solid blender

Author: Amber M
Title: I am gonna save SO MUCH $$$!!! Lol
Body: Omg! My Dreams have TRUE!!! Made my first smoothie last night and it was the MOST PERFECT smoothie I've ever had in my LIFE!! Lol I was so afraid that it would blend the ice properly; I've had problems in the past with blenders where the ice and drink begin to separate... but not this blender! The buttons are labeled and pretty strait forward. You want a milkshake? Push the milkshake button. You want a smoothie? Push button labeled smoothie. Icey drink, crush ice, puree... you get it. And this product is beautiful! The glass is thick and sturdy and I absolutely adore the lid which has a lip under the spout to place upon your cup to minimize spilling. I am SO happy with my purchase and recommend this to everyone :)

A good blender should take couple of minutes to make. This blender took about 10-15 minutes. It would not chop the basil and the consistency of the pesto sauce was not smooth as it should have been. On other occasion I tried making a smoothie and it would not crush the ice to a consistency it had to be, pieces of ice remained bulky.

Author: joyfulmoo
Title: Good for soft stuff, but can't handle frozen fruit or ice!
Body: My husband and I got this as a gift from my mom pretty soon after we got married. We had a Magic Bullet before and I wanted something with more power to make my smoothies with frozen fruit and ice.Positives: This blender is a great price and it had good reviews. My husband loved it for milkshakes (ice cream, bananas, caramel, etc) and had no issues with it. I made homemade salsa in it and it worked great (tomatoes & juice, a few other veggies, etc) It is very heavy and well made, and it all comes apart to easily wash. Lid snaps well, never had any leaking problems.Negatives: HATE this blender for smoothies. It has 4 very small blades at the very bottom of the base and it can't handle frozen fruit or ice. Literally nothing happens, the fruit just gets bounced around, and the ice won't even be chipped. It has to have at least 1.5 cups of liquid before it will blend effectively, which either leads to watery smoothies or smoothies with extra fruit juice/milk, which adds unnecessary calories. I found all the buttons useless, it doesn't seem to do anything different no matter which button you press.All in all, it's fine if you're looking for a milkshake maker, or something to make purees in or things like that. I would NOT recommend it for smoothies or frozen drinks.

Author: Fistandaltiis
Title: Not the best product for the money
Body: The wave action only works after you open the lid, and scoop the items on top down to the bottom by stirring it yourself. Once you have done that a few times, then the wave action' kicks in. I'm using it to make fruit smoothies. Also the plastic lid is incredibly difficult to get on once you seal it on tight.

Title: Buyer Beware! Do NOT buy this blender. You WILL be sorry.
Body: This blender is a joke. I made a chocolate milkshake with a ripe banana added, and it was so loud, you might think I was blending rocks. Then, it vibrated so much that the cheap little buttons were rattling all around, and I literally had to hold the lid on the entire time to prevent it from popping off. After blending with this thing for an entire minute, there were still huge chunks of banana in the shake. Do NOT buy this piece of crap! I am convinced the good reviews for this product are bogus.

I constantly have to take the lid off – which doesn't come off easily – and push the food down to the blades. That's what happens when you try to save money – guess I should have paid for a Ninja.

But it does work, it just takes a few extra minutes and I have to remove it and give a shake before proceeding from time to time. It is also rather loud.

Title: I have yet to smell anything from the motor and it really doesn't sound like its straining
Body: Let's keep things in context. This is an inexpensive blender. I've used it about 10 times thus far mostly to make veggie drinks.It performs this task quite well. I do chop the vegetables before putting them in and it grinds very well. I read the reviews prior to buying so let me respond to a few concerns. I have yet to smell anything from the motor and it really doesn't sound like its straining. As far a noise, this is probably my fourth blender and it is no more noisy that any other I've had. And lastly, there was some complaints about getting the lid off. Simply pull it up from the bottom part of the lip. It has a solid glass container and it's easy to clean. A great blender for the price.

Author: Scott T
Title: Totally decent, not quite amazing
Body: After reading some of the reviews here, I figured this was the best blender without making a significant investment--and it turned out pretty true. While not an absolutely incredible blender, it gets the job done and at the right price. After owning and using it regularly for about a month now, I feel familiar enough with it to give it a review.The jar is glass, and seems sturdy--the blade assembly at the bottom comes apart for easy cleaning. The 'wave' refers to indentations in the glass on each side so the shape is less like a cylinder, making ingredients mix together a little better--and it seems to work, powdery/ground-up ingredients get evenly dispersed throughout.The cap is made of a reasonably flexible plastic. Other complaints that it's hard to remove are well-founded, but if you know what to expect, it's really not bad at all (for example, from the reviews, I assumed it to be a massive pain, when, in fact, it's only a minor inconvenience). The pour spout is very convenient and works well if you're afraid of spilling anything while fighting to get the cap off--and it does stick on there pretty good--and I've yet to have any leakage, even when blending large amounts (a hot tomato bisque filled nearly to the brim didn't leak at all--phew). I've also found that holding the handle and using that thumb to lever up the tab usually gets the lid off without much fuss.The blender itself is pretty loud, I think, movies/music/etc. have to be paused if it's nearby. There are 8 buttons implying 8 different speeds, but on my unit (maybe it's broken?) there doesn't seem to be much difference between the first 4 and last 4 buttons--that is, it seems to be 2 speeds, with the first 4 buttons all being low-speed, and the last 4 buttons being high speed. It still works more than fine, but I could see it causing problems if blending thicker items that need more incremental speed increases. The furthest left and furthest right buttons are pulse buttons--nice to have that in 2 different speeds on a blender at in this price range. Minimal 'hot electric' smell after running at a higher speed for about 30-40 seconds, but chews up ice and frozen fruits (from strawberries to broken-in-half bananas), so really what more can you ask for at this cost?

Author: Josh C.
Title: Great blender at a great price
Body: I purchased this as a replacement for my magic bullet that bit the dust after about 2 years of almost daily use. With the promotional sale this blender was about $15 more than what I paid for the bullet. I wish I would've bought this 2 years ago. This blender is use daily for breakfast smoothies. It blends frozen fruit, fresh fruit, vegetables, peanut butter, and milk into a uniform consistency. I've had no issues in several months of use. I really like the glass pitcher. It's much easier to clean than the plastic bullet and blends much faster.

Title: Good blender
Body: I got this blender after my old, normal, skinny one died, and I like this one more. The larger glass bottom seems to keep things from getting stuck down there, and it blends better. It's not the most amazing blender in the world, but it does everything I need. My one complaint is that the lid doesn't stick on great, and it often leaks when I use the top to pour my smoothies into a glass. But that's a small inconvenience, and it's a good value for the price.

Body: Works okay. There are all these different settings, and only a few actually work well. Don't expect to be cutting up a bunch of veggies and fruits, no matter how fine you slice them, and blending them in this for some salsa and whatnot. It does make a delicious smoothie though.

Title: Classy
Body: High Quality and Tough"
Image links: I must say..........This blender is very tough. Very tough indeed. You can grind ANYTHING in it. This blender is a well constructed, hard-working grinding / blending machine.Out of the many blenders I've had; this is the only one made with a glass container. The glass is thick, heavy, tough. I like it. The rest that I've had were made of plastic and didn't last very long.I very strongly recommend this blender to anyone who is in the market for such a device.

Author: Vincent
Title: Shockingly great blender for the price
Body: Shockingly great blender for the price. I love that it is made of glass, which is easier to clean, lasts longer, and can be filled with really hot temperature items. The buttons are a bit much, especially since the difference between two right next to each other is hardly noticeable. Either way, great product. I use it to make milkshakes and baby food. For the price you have to expect to occasionally have to stir to get the blender going but I am ok with that. If I wasn't I'd get a $300 blender instead. 5 stars for the price and quality!

Crushes whole lumps of ice in no time, pulverizes my fruit beautifully, and, aside from smoothies, I whipped up eggs for a airy omelette this morning! The only reason I took off a star was because the electric cord is waaaay too short. I'm probably going to buy an extension. Big deal....

It's not going to shop everything to a fine liquid. I eat a raw diet so I make a lot of smoothies and this left them still fairly chunky. Not bad, but definitely chunky. Other than it not being a super powerful motor it's a great blender with various speeds. If you want a fully liquified blend, you'll have to step it up with a Vitamix or a Ninja or something equiv.

I was even more shocked when I saw it pulverize large ice cubes. The lid fits snug so you have no spill overs. The pouring spout is wonderful. Last but not least, the measuring levels are clear and easy to see. I have already dropped the the glass part on the carpet and not one crack. I would still avoid doing that.This blender is sturdy, easy to use and very easy to clean.

The ring that screws into the bottom is just about 1.75 in depth, which keeps it steadily set into the blender base opening. The lid has been improved from the last Hamilton Beach model I had. It is much more functional and is cleaned up easier. There are plenty of speed settings, and two pulse settings. It's a great blender and a great value. I am considering buying a second one to keep on hand for when this one wears out in a few years - I like this model that much!
